loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 36 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الدجاج وغيره له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله يتميز بالدقة والنظافة في العمل يريد ان يساعد عائلته على تطوير نفسها وزيادة المدخول للعائلة خاصة ان لديه اطفال في بداية الدراسة يحب ان يتطور عمله له خبرة كبيرة في عمله وهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل البضائع يسعى الى زيادة زبائنه من خلال تقديم خدماة اكبر فهو يتميز بكثرة الزبائن من جيرانه واقاربه
texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and married with three children. He sells chickens for a living and has 20 years experience in this. He loves his job and is distinguished for hygiene and attention to detail in his work. He wants to increase his family's income and help them develop, especially since his children are beginning their education. He wants to develop his work and has extensive experience in his job. With this loan he wants to purchase a pick-up truck to transport his goods. He wants to increase his clientèle by way of providing a better service. He has many customers from amongst his relatives and neighbours.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck for transporting goods.

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen V. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 22 years old. Bebialen is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Bebialen owns and operates a business venture that makes and sells barbecue in the market. Bebialen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bebialen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Bebialen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Bebialen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchased meat, sticks, electric fan, spices and utensils to be used for expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bebialen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase meat, sticks, electric fan, spices and utensils to be used for expanding the business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by buying and selling palm toddy (palm wine) and operating a general store. Her husband Francisco, who is 59 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 22 years old. Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000  to buy more palm toddy to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future for the education of her only child. Nenita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase palm toddy to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.ar: جهاد في عمر 35 سنة متزوج وله 2 اولاد يعمل في تصليح وصيانة ادوات كهربائية من طابعات وغيره له في عمله 19 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطور عمله يسعى من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى زيادة البضائع وتوسيع العمل له خبرة كبيرة في مجال تصليح الطابعات والمولدات يحب ان يتقدم في عمله وان يزيد من مدخول عائلته دائم التجدد فهو مقصد في محيطه للزبائن حيث يتميز بالنشاط والعمل الصحيح
texts.en: Jihad is 35 years old and is married with two children. He works in the production and repair of electrical appliances, such as printers, and has 19 experience in this. He loves his work and wants to develop it. With the loan he wants to buy more stock and expand his business. He has a lot of experience in the repair of printers and generators. With this loan he wants to increase his family income. He is a progressive person and his business is unique in his area. He is known for his quick and reliable service.

loans.use: to purchase stock and expand business

loans.name: Yâm

texts.en:
Yâm Pha has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. She also has a life partner in her husband who is a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. 

Yâm Pha is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more recyclables to increase her husband's profit. The couple is blessed with one young child. Yâm Pha and her son appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable goods to sell to a wholesaler.

loans.name: Gombojav

texts.en:
Gombojav T., 45, is married and lives with his wife and three daughters in Uvruhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. 

His wife is self-employed and her two older daughters attend college while the youngest daughter goes to a secondary school. 

Gombojav began his food selling business in 2005. He purchased food stuffs from the city and sold them in the countryside using his own car. 

In 2006, he set up a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the countryside and operated it as a cafeteria and a shop where he sold food stuffs and consumer goods. Afterwards his business became less profitable so that he has recently begun operating a stall  at a local market in the city.

He is a hardworking and polite person who wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to purchase more food stuffs and consumer goods for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs and consumer goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with one parent and six siblings. He is from Lebanon.  He works as an electrician on a freelance basis upon clients' requests. Despite his young age, he works hard to be able to help his father with the family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools needed. In that way, he will be able to take on more projects and expand his business operation.  He is hoping to increase his earnings. In the future, he wants to open up his own electric shop.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new tools.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has four adult children.

To make a living, Zenaida plants and harvests flowers for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. 

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta W., 33 years old, is from Murumba. She is married to Erick and they have three children aged 9, 7 and 5 years old.

Redempta has been selling fish for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a client. Redempta will use the loan to buy more fish to add to her stock. Her monthly income is KES 1,700 and she hopes that this will rise. The profits from the loan proceeds will be used to pay school fees for Redempta's children. She hopes to be able to open up another fish stall soon.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma T. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Gemma is married and has four adult children.

To make a living, Gemma raises pigs for sale. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar: محمد يبلغ 46 سنة متزوج  ويعمل في زراعة وتنسيق الحدائق له  17 سنة في عمله، وهو يحب عمله كثيراً ويتميز به في الابتكار والتطور. يسعى محمد الى تطوير عمله من خلال شراء أدوات زراعية متطورة، بالإضافة إلى البذور الجديدة وذلك لإستقطاب أكبر عدد من الزبائن بما يرضي أذواقهم، لهذا تقدم بطلب  قرض من المجموعة.زبائنه هم جيرانه، أصدقاء وأقارب. خبرته كبيرة وهو يتميز بذوقه الرفيع بحبسب ما يقوله عنه زبائنه.
texts.en: Mouhamad is 46 years old and married. He works as a gardener cultivating and growing flowers and has 17 years of experience. He loves his work and is innovative and progressive in it. He wants to expand his business. With this loan he hopes to have enough capital to purchase more tools and materials. His customers include his neighbours and those that live around him. His business is unique.

loans.use: To purchase new improved tools and seeds to expand his business

loans.name: Shurnee

texts.en:
Shurnee, 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in an apartment and they have a decent standard of living. Her husband works as a customs officer and her two children go to a kindergarden. 

Shurnee began her bakery business in 2009, after graduating from vocational training. In the beginning, she got a loan of 600,000 MNT from our bank to start her business, and she paid it back. She used to make only bread, and now she makes a variety of bread, muffins and donuts. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, " I would like to expand my business and operate a bigger bakery ". She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more kitchen tools and materials for her bakery business.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen tools and materials

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Felina is married and has 4 adult children. Felina owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Felina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to raise young livestock for sale. Felina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marcellina Mwene

texts.en:
Marcellina W. is 26 years old. She is from Murumba and is married to Gaston.They have two children who are 5 and 3 years old.

Marcellina is a fishmonger and has been in this business for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd and intends to use the money to buy more fish to add to her stock. Her monthly income is 2,200 Kenyan shillings.

She hopes to be the main supplier of fish to major markets.

loans.use: To buy more fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia does embroidery for her neighborhood clients to support her family financially. She is very skillful in her work and learned this art from her mother before her marriage. She earns a reasonable income every month. She uses that money to pay utility bills and the school fees of her children.  
She is the mother of 4 daughters and 2 sons. Her elder son is a daily wage laborer, and her elder daughter does embroidery to help her mother in fulfilling the orders on time. The other three are enrolled in school.  Razia is a resident of Haji Ghaggan, which is a small residential area in Kasur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She came here 25 years ago.  

Her husband, J. I. M., runs a construction supply business from a shop in the market.  He also has a dairy business, selling milk from the buffalo at his home.  He is very good dealing with customers and receives a good number of orders every month. Both businesses are a good source of income for him.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo, which will increase the milk productivity for him.  Razia is hopeful that the investment will be a productive one for her husband, and that her family’s life style will be improved.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar T. is 49 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school and one of whom works as a tourist camp guide.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife works as a kitchen assistant at a small restaurant. Ganbaatar has been working as a truck driver for different transportation companies for his entire life. In 2007 he left his employer and bought a small truck to run his own delivery business. He has clients who run businesses at outdoor markets and use his service.  Ganbaatar’s truck is getting old and requires proper servicing. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to service his truck including engine, shock absorbers, and brake system.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his truck

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut S. is a 29-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with a kid, who is now attending the public high school. Her husband, Khut S., is 31. He is a car driver and earns a profit of about $2.50 daily. 

Khut S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she grows different kinds of crops. With this loan, Khut S. will buy a plot of land from a villager in order to build a new house, which will be bigger than her current house. This will allow her whole family to get a comfortable house. 

Khut S. and her husband appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for building a new house

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita H. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Juanita raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2005, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be Juanita's eighth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 44 years, is married and a father of eight children with seven still in school. He has been in mixed farming for ten years, producing and selling milk, maize and beans to the local market. He  relies solely on farming to support his family.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says an additional dairy cow will definitely improve his production, supplement family foods, and enable him to pay for his children's education in better schools. He is focusing on having five dairy cows and being a major supplier for the local market.

Joseph however laments scarcity of water and animal feed during dry seasons. He is happy to have access to loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal, 38, is married and lives with his mother and wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. He worked for a jewelery-making company between 1993 and 1995. He began operating his own goldsmith business in 1995. By operating his business he was able to buy the land and build his house. 

He bought a car in 2009 with the profit from his business. Then he began purchasing gold and silver items which he uses for his smith business from individuals. His wife is helping him with the purchase these days because he got injured because of an accident last summer. Now he operates his business at home. 

Jargal is a hardworking person who says, "I and my wife are working hard in order to buy an apartment where we can have a comfortable life in the future." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more gold and silver items for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more gold and silver items.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina L. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Vivina is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Vivina owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Vivina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Vivina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Vivina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new transport unit. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Vivina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new transport unit.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 71, is married with two children, ages 26 and 42 years old. He has been practicing mixed farming for 22 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. He is currently producing milk which he sells to local restaurants and households. He also employs 3 farmhands. He is a retired civil servant hence depends on his pension to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase artificial insemination equipment for storing semen. He says that the profits from this business will assist him in paying school fees for his three grandchildren who are currently attending school. He says that he would like to own all kinds of artificial insemination equipment in future, acquire three motorcycles and employ three employees to enhance his profession.

He further comments that the cost of artificial insemination inputs is expensive hence farmers prefer to use the traditional bulls to service their animals.

loans.use: To purchase artificial insemination equipment.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar, 40, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They have been living in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard since 2006. They used to live in Hentii province before 2006 and he used to operate a carpentry business with his brothers.  

When he came to Ulaanbaatar, he continued operating his carpentry business. In the beginning, he used to make wooden products at home. In 2010, he began operating a workshop with a good location. He wants to expand his business and increase his production in the future. He is a hardworking and initiative person. He says, "I am trying to expand my business and increase my profit in order to have my own land and a house." He is requesting a loan of 820,000 MNT to purchase more wood materials and equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 21 سنة ليس متزوج يعمل في بيع الخبز و (المناقيش) له في عمله 9 سنوات يحب عمله ويريد الى تطوير العمل يحب ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يبني عائلة له تكون اساسها متين وتطوير نفسه اجتماعية وماديا يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء قطاعة للمخبز + زيادة البضائع يتميز بالانفراد في العمل في منطقته فهو متميز ودقيق في العمل
texts.en: Hussein is 21 years old, married and works in a bakery. He has nine years experience in this. He loves what he does and wants to develop his business. He would like to be independent and start a family on a secure and solid foundation. He wants to progress and develop on a social and financial level. With this loan he wants to purchase a cutter for his bakery as well as more raw materials. His work is unique in his local area and he pays excellent attention to detail in his work.

loans.use: to purchase a cutter and raw materials for bakery

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a 3-room brick house with her family for many years. She is 46 years old, married to G. D., and has 3 children. All of them are very young and enrolled in a local high school for getting education. 

Her husband is a goldsmith. He operates his business and has a shop in the market. He is very good at customer relationships and never compromised on quality. He sells through his shop different types of jewelry like gold, silver, and costume jewelry. He always provides quality services to his customers, that’s why his customers trust him and obtain his services regularly. 

Abida herself does sewing. She takes orders from her neighboring clients and fills them on time to earn income for her family. The money she earns is used to pay her children's school fees. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy silver and beads for making jewelry such as bangles, earrings, etc. This will help him provide better quality services to his customers and make more profits. He has been operating this business for the past 30 years and Abida is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy silver and beads for jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the major part of 32-year-old Meas S.’s daily duties in the garment industry. Meas S. has been working in her position for over three years and has a fixed salary every month. 

She has a life partner in her husband, who works in the same field. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two kids. Both of the kids are attending school. 

They are concerned that they face difficulties in traveling to their job location. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi as they don't have their own vehicle. In order to deal with the problem, Meas S. has requested a loan to buy a new motorbike to commute their workplace without hiring a taxi. 

Note that the couple is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to commute their workplace without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products and needed supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Salamu W.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Mufariji, âgée de 31 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant. La  cliente  Salamu W. fait également le petit commerce de divers. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans les affaires. Ils ont un magasin dans le centre commercial de Birere - Ville de Goma. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Vers 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (savon Omo, lait de beauté, souliers, casseroles, valises, habits, lait Nido,  sardines, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et construire des maisons à mettre à location. La cliente Salamu W.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Mufariji est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Salamu W., age 31, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Mufariji group. Her husband is a retailer. Salamu W. also retails various products, and she and her husband help each other in business. They have a store at the Birere shopping center in the city of Goma.

She's been running this business for three years. Around 2009, she received her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital. This new loan will be used to buy new supplies ("Omo" soap, beauty milk, shoes, saucepans, suitcases, clothing, "Nido" milk, sardines, etc.). Furthermore, she ambitions to ensure the future of her business and build houses to rent.

Salamu W. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Mufariji group comprises 15 members.

loans.use: to buy soap, beauty milk, shoes, saucepans, suitcases, etc

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna S. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Johnna is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Johnna owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating "tricycle" transport services. Johnna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Johnna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Johnna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Johnna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Jannie

texts.en:
Jannie F. is from the village of TABOC SUR, OROQ. CITY. She is 39 years old. Jannie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jannie works in a family member's business venture in a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to the local community. Jannie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jannie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jannie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle and to purchase other accessories like raincoat for better services. This will be the first loan taken out by Jannie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle and to purchase other accessories like raincoat for better services

loans.name: Baylagsuren

texts.en:
Baylagsuren, 38, lives with his family in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has two kids who attend kindergarten and an elder son in secondary school. He owned & operated a bus, as a means for public transportation, from 2004 to 2008. 

Since 2008, Baylagsuren has been transporting goods by a truck with towing capacity of 65 ton. He transports goods in the country as well as from Ereen, a border city of China. He is busy all the time, driving from one location to another since he gained costumers who constantly trade goods from Ereen and other places. 

Baylagsuren is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase new tires for his truck. He is a responsible and trustworthy, and  dreams to establish his own public transportation company.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his truck

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 40 years old and is married with three sons, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is a scrap dealer who sells scrap to factories as well as scrap shop owners. Rukhsana supports her husband financially by selling clothes. She is very supportive in nature. She receives orders from her neighboring clients, and she sells clothes to them by purchasing from the city of Lahore. For this purpose, she visits Lahore twice a month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk that will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and earn better profits. She started this business 10 years ago, and she hopes that an investment will improve it further. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. She belongs to Kasur, a small city of Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She lives there in the area of Rakhanpura with her family in a three-room brick house.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk for clothes selling business

loans.name: Joeriza

texts.en:
Joeriza E. is from the village of LABO, ALORAN, MIS. OCC.. She is 27 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Joeriza owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing retail mineral water in the community. Joeriza has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2011, Joeriza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joeriza is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Joeriza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business invest in another branch for the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alice

texts.ar: اليس في عمر 49 سنة متزوجة تعمل في محل لبيع الالبسة النسائية لها في عملها 16 سنة تحب عملها وتريد التجدد والتطور به فهي تعمل في سوق يعرضها للتنافس دائما هذا من اكثر المصاعب التي تواجهها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاع جديدة للمحل وخاصة باقتراب فصل الصيف والربيع هي متميزة في العمل حيث دائمة التجديد ولها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق بتطوير نفسها من خلال فتح قسم اكبر في المحل
texts.en: Alice is 49 years old and married. She works in a store selling women's clothes. She has 16 years experience in this. She loves her business and is seeking to develop and renew it. This is because she works in a market and is constantly exposed to competition, the one problem she constantly faces in her work. With this loan she wants to buy new stock for her shop, especially since spring and summer are approaching. She is distinguished in her work as she is constantly striving to keep up to date. Her customers include her neighbours and people from her local area. She has a very good credit history with Al Majmoua and the last loan contributed to the opening of a new department in her store.

loans.use: to buy new clothing stock for her shop

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin D. is from the city of POB. 1, OROQUIETA CITY. He is 55 years old. Benjamin is single. To make a living, Benjamin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Benjamin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP. A portion of this loan will be used to purchased piglets and feeds to help expand the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Benjamin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased piglets and feeds to help expand the business.

loans.name: Pram

texts.en:
Pram K., 28 years old, owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells soft drinks, food, plastic products, sweets, cooking ingredients and other products. She typically makes around $3.75 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. 

She has been married for many years to Thik Thy, 28, a local teacher in the province of Siem Reap, and they have only one child who is studying. Pram K.’s husband goes to work by taking an existing motorcycle, which Pram K. also uses for transportation of her items when she goes to buy at the busy market. Her husband sometimes goes to his workplace by hiring motor taxi, and he used to miss his work because of no vehicle. To solve an obstacle, Pram K. would like to request a loan to be used to purchase a new motorcycle, which will be used by her husband to ride to his job location.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle which will used by her husband to ride to his job location

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta R. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Crisanta is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Souna

texts.ar: سونا في عمر 43 سنة متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد هم على عاتقها تعمل سونا في خياطة وتصليح الجزادين والشنط لها في عمله 23 سنة تحب عملها وتولي له اهتمام كبير عائلتها واولادها اكثر اهتمامها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة جديدة للمصلحة + صيانة للمنزل لتأمين معيشة جيدة لأولادها لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد تلقت الدعم الكامل من العائلة فهي مثابرة ونشيطة
texts.en: Souna is 43 years old. She is married with four children for whom she shoulders responsibility. Souna works as a tailor and also repairs bags and purses. She has 23 years experience in this. She loves her work. Though it is important to her, her children and family are also her priority. With this loan she wants to purchase a new sewing machine and perform some maintenance work on her house in order to secure a good standard of living for her children. She has a good credit history with Al Majmoua and has the full support of her family as she is persistent and energetic.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and perform some home maintenance

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai T. H.  is 40 years old with one child  who is attending high school.  Being a farmer,  her main activities  focus on growing rice, clean vegetables, and  raising chickens.  After divorcing in 2008, she has to work more  in order to provide a good education for her  child. She has increased the numbers of paddy to grow more kinds of vegetables. In this way, she  can earn stable income  to manage her family life. 

Participating in our credit program since 2009, she has been a good  re-payer and used  loans effectively in develop her farming. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy  feed  for chickens and fertilizer  for rice.

loans.use: to buy  feed for chickens and fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is 38 years old. Her husband’s name is A. A. and he operates a clothes-selling business. His shop is located in the bazaar from where he sells a variety of women's and men's clothes, etc. He offers competitive prices to customers who buy clothes from him regularly. He also does a second business which is construction supplies. He fulfills the requirements for construction supplies of his customers and supplements the household income.  
Kousar supports her husband in his clothes-selling business. She has a good number of customers in neighboring areas. She fills their orders and earns extra income. 

She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her two elder sons sell salt packs to different departmental stores and others are studying in a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy clothes for the expansion of his clothes-selling business. This will help him offer more variety to his customers and earn better profit. He has been operating this business for the past 3 years and Kousar is very much hopeful that it will further improve after the loan investment. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her 1st loan application to Asasah.  She belongs to Kasur which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Jamatpura.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr: Suzana M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Chance, âgée de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants.  Son conjoint est l’autorité de base d’une avenue (chef d’avenue). La  cliente  Suzana M. est vendeuse des braises. Elle s’installe au marché sectoriel Afia Bora. Depuis sa jeunesse,  Suzana M. exerce cette activité.  Vers 2008, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter une moto pour faire le taxi urbain (trans-ville)  et accroitre à plus ses revenus. Elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise. La cliente Suzana M. confirme avoir réalisé tant des projets avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. La cliente Suzana M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Chance est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Suzana M., age 60, is married and the mother of ten children. She's an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Chance group. Her husband is "chef d'avenue" (exercising authority over his neighborhood). Suzana M. sells charcoal at the sectorial market Afia Bora.

She's been running this business since her youth. Around 2008, she got her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital. This new loan will be used to buy a motorcycle, to provide passenger transportation services across the city and increase her income. She ambitions to ensure the future of her business.

Suzana M. confirms having carried out many projects thanks to Hekima's loan. She thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Chance group comprises 15 members.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. D. is a 30-year-old woman with an only son who lives in  Thai Binh  hamlet. She has a small restaurant that serves Pho (soup)– a very  popular food  in Vietnam. Her  restaurant opened in 2006 one year before she got her  first loan from our credit program. With the  first loan, she   bought  a refrigerator to keep  beef  fresh. 

Year after year now, she has received 7 loans in all and used them very effectively in expanding  her business. Every month, she earns 3,000,000 VND  profit from this restaurant.  Regarding her  repayment attitude, she is always a good re-payer.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of  7,194,000 VND  to invest in her little restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in her soup restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a farmer in Kitale Town in Western Kenya. She has been in mixed farming for five years  producing milk, eggs, vegetables and beans which she sells to the local market. She is married with six children of whom four are of school-going age. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the milk produce will be a great food supplement for the family as well as earn her income from her sales. Priscah is focusing on increasing the number of her dairy cows and buying a motorcycle to help in transportation of produce to the market.

Animal diseases and food shortage remain the greatest threats to business in her opinion.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.ar: يوسف يبلغ من العمر 39 سنة متزوج يعمل في بيع الدجاج واللحم له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يتطور. يسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتحسين مستوى معيشته،لذلك عمد إلى طلب قرض من المجموعة وذلك بهدف زيادة رأس ماله وشراء بضاعة بسعر أوفر. يتمييز عمله بالنظافة والدقة، له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق بتطوير مصلحته كثيراً، وهو يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Youssef is 39, married and works in a butcher's selling chicken and red meat. He has 20 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop it as he is always seeking to increase his income. With this loan he wants to achieve business security by buying products in larger quantities at lower prices. He is distinguished for hygiene and attention to detail in his work. He has good credit history with the company and his last loan contributed to developing his store. He also has the full support of his family.

loans.use: To increase his Capital through buying his products with low prices

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a 30-year-old lady. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he has a construction supplies business. He sells supplies to different construction companies and to regular customers who comes to buy supplies from him. He is very good at his business dealings and receives a good number of orders every month.  

Sakina shares the financial burden with her husband by selling clothes. She buys clothes from city of Lahore, travelling there twice a month, and sells to her local area customers for a profit. She has four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works with his father in his construction supplies business while the others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest son who is only 4 years old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement and sand, etc. that will help him to fill larger orders on time and to earn better profits. Sakina is very confident that her husband’s five years of experience in his business will help him earn better profits after the investment and he will be able to provide better living facilities to his family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She belongs to Kasur which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She lives there with her family in a small home which contains two rooms.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha  T. N. is 26  years old with two children who are in school. She is  a very hard-working farmer. Currently, she is growing rice, beens, and corn in a paddy of 4,200 square meters.  Her agricultural  produce is used to support her family's food demands. A part is sold  to earn daily income. 

Joining in the Seda credit program  in 2007, she has used her loans very effectively  and always is good re-payer.  To buy  seed and fertilizer for the next crop, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND.

loans.use: To buy  seed and fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Imad

texts.ar: عماد في عمر 29 سنة اعزب يعمل في تعهدات الديكور له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله وهو كل اهتمامه يريد ان يزيد من مدخول العمل وان يتطور له ف عمله حب ومعرفة يتميز بالتطور والتجدد الدائم زبائنه هم من محيطه ومعارفه كان له القرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد وقد كان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لتحسين العمل
texts.en: Imad is 29 years old and unmarried. He works in interior design and house decoration. He has 15 years experience in this work and it is his sole priority.  He wants to increase his income and develop his work. He is a progressive and up to date individuA. and has customers from his locA. area, many of whom he knows. His previous loan from A. Majmoua produced very good results. With this loan he would like to buy raw materials to improve his work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to improve his interior design business

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen  L. T. is 28 years old  with two children who  are at primary school.  Being a  tailor, she  opened a shop that makes trousers and shirts. Her shop is always busy with the orders of customers. She can get 3,500,000 VND profit per month. Her shop became more developed when she decided to take out loans from Seda credit program and invested all in her business.  Currently, she wants to have  a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy cloth to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cloth to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en: Hao T. T. V. is 30 years old and has two children who attend primary school.  Being a tailor, she opened a shop that makes trousers and t-shirts. Her shop is always busy with customers' orders. She earns 3,500,000 VND profit per month. Her shop improved when she borrowed from the SEDA credit program and invested her loans in her business.  Currently, she is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy clothes to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Sharshengul

texts.en:
Sharshengul T. is a 50-year-old farmer who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is widowed and has four grow-up children; her youngest son lives with her and helps in the household. In 1998, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Sharshengul decided to start her own cattle breeding business. With a starting capital of 20,000 KGS, she managed to expand her farm. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastured it in mountainous areas with native grasses. With her business revenues, she was able to provide her children with all they needed.
Sharshengul's farm now amounts to one cow and two calves. She plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her business and buy a car for transporting milk and meat products to other regions.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Biady

texts.en:
Biady is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Biady has operated a fruit-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. The major challenge Biady faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future. Biady decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase mangoes, bananas and passion fruits for making juice.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, bananas and passion fruits for making juice

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. N. is 35 years old and has three children who are in high school or secondary school. She has a shop that provides a motor repair service. She has run the shop for four years and was able to develop her business further when she took a loan from SEDA's credit program. In so doing, she created a stable income that helped her to  manage her family life and pay her children's school fees. During her time participating in the SEDA project, she has been a good repayer. For this loan, she is requesting 9,374,000 VND to buy more motor parts to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more motor parts to meet customer demand

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline N. is 22 years old, married and has a one-year-old daughter. She would like to give her daughter a good education to university level. Everline's business is located at Eregi in Kakamega, a region in Kenya known for sugarcane production and normally referred to as the 'sugarbelt' region. For the past three years she has owned a general store in which she sells items such as detergents, soft drinks, rice, sugar etc. to local people. She says that her business is profitable but the major challenge she faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as a social and easygoing lady.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Bassam

texts.ar: بسام في عمر 42 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في زرع الحدائق والمشاتل له في عمله 25 سنة يحب عمله ويتقنه جيدا يحب عائلته ويريد تعليم اولاده بشكل جيد يسعى دائما الى تطوير عمله وعائلته ماديا ومعنويا له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى دائما الدعم الكامل من العائلة وقد ساهم في زيادة مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة البيك اب وتكملة القسط الجامعي للأبن
texts.en: Bassam is 42 years old and married with three children. He works in agriculture and has 25 years experience in this. He does his work with excellence. He loves his family and wants his children to receive an excellent education. He is always seeking to develop his work and provide the means for his family's financiA. and sociA. progress. He has a good history with the company and has the constant support of his family. It has contributed to an increase in his income. With this loan he wants to perform maintenance work on his pick-up truck and secure a university place for his son.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his pick-up truck and secure a university place for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Dat

texts.en: Dat ThiV. is 42 years old and has two children who attend school. She has a shop that provides motor bike repair services.  She has been in this business for four years and was able to expand it when she borrowed from the SEDA credit program.  Her business provides a stable income for her  family and allows her to pay school fees.  She is requesting a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy a motor bike washing machine to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike washing machine

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is 45 years old. He is from Bungoma and is married to Margaret. They have two children aged 10 years and seven years old.

Lucas is a tailor and is known for making nice outfits for his clients. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. Lucas intends to use the money to buy more materials to add to his stock to enable him serve his clients well. He earns a monthly income of KES 13,500.

He desires to open up a tailoring college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabric) to add to his stock

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 46-year-old lady who runs a food stall business. She is married to Suhaemi, 52, and they have 3 children, namely: 
1. Zulkarnain, 25 years old 
2. Hendra, 19 years old
3. Tria W., 18 years old who is in the second semester of University – midwifery faculty

Salma and family are living in Tuak Daun Merah Village. She has been running the food stall business for 3 years. The food stall is situated near to the main road and about 2 km from her residence. Salma usually starts the business at 8 am and closes at 10 pm. In addition to selling rice and side dishes, Salma is also selling fried bananas, tofu and fermented soybean cake. 

Salma’s business is running well. There are a lot of customers who come to her food stall. Even so, Salma plans to improve her business by adding more items and purchasing more chairs. Customers want a variety of items so they will not get bored. She does not want to lose her customers. On the other hand, she also has to manage her money as well as her daughter – Tria needs money for her education fees especially for the practical exam fee. Salma is aware that both her business and Tria’s education are important.

In order to meet her business needs, Salma is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 IDR. With the loan, she would like to purchase various foodstuffs to cook and sell at her food stall and to purchase several new chairs. Salma really hopes TLM will support her in implementing her plan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and several new chairs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Rehema   has a beauty salon, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids andoil for the hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rehema hopes to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase braids and oil for the hair.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh T. N. is a 33-year-old woman with 3 children who is living in Luc Canh hamlet. She joined with our credit program in 2004. Being in business when she fist received a loan size of 1,425,000 VND, she invested in opening a small restaurant that serves breakfast. Her business has developed more and more and created a stable income for her to manage her family life. Since participating in our credit program, she has always been a good re-payer. To buy sets of table and desks, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,374,000 VND

loans.use: To buy more equipment

loans.name: Orpa

texts.en:
Orpa is a 39-year-old lady who lives in Bolok village – which is situated about 11 km from Kupang City. Orpha is married and blessed with 4 children, named:
• Sisilia M., 19 years old, in the second semester of university
• Yoseph Fernando, 13 years old, in the second grade of junior high school
• Excelino and Valentino, 4 years old - twins

Orpa has a poultry business. She runs this business to help her husband, Blasius, to generate more income for their family. Orpha and family can not rely on Blasius’ income as a laborer because his income is insufficient to meet their daily needs and the education needs of the children.

Orpha recognizes that now her family's needs are improving since her daughter, Sisilia, is in the university. As parents, Orpha and her husband are responsible for their children’s future. Nevertheless, Orpha is grateful for the business, and she is encouraged to go ahead. 

Currently, Orpha is breeding 200 chicks; it takes 40 days to sell them at the market. Orpha has been considering adding more chicks to generate more income. Orpha wishes to get a business loan from TLM. She is requesting a loan amounting to 4,500,000 IDR. She plans to purchase more chicks and to renovate the coop. She is expecting that the loan application will be approved. She believes that the loan will have a good impact on her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy T. T. N., a 26-year-old widow with three children, sells chickens for meat everyday at the market. She began the business upon receiving her first loan in 2006, and it has developed quickly and created a stable income for her to manage her life. Never late in her repayments, Thuy now hopes to borrow 9,374,000 VND to buy more chickens and to improve her shop.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and to improve her shop.

loans.name: Mazher

texts.en:
Mazher is a 43-year-old single man from Metn. He has worked as a butcher for 11 years. Mazher is  requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve his business. He needs to buy new improved machines in addition to lower priced meat through paying cash. 

Mazher is well known in his region. His clients especially appreciate his cleanliness and high quality products.  Mazher has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven consecutive years. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business. He used to pay to rent on his shop but because his business improved he was able to buy his shop which is a good improvement. He's very proud of himself. Mazher is a  borrower in good standing.

loans.use: To buy new improved machines necessary to his business

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 35 years old and lives with her retired mother in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in an apartment that they bought in 2005. She graduated from the National University of Mongolia as a lawyer and established her legal advice and advocacy center in 2001. She has been operating her business for 12 years while earning her Master's degree in 2005. 

Oyunchimeg currently rents the place where she operates her business. She has gained a lot of experience in this field. She is a hard-working and polite person who says, "I like to help others. By operating my legal advice center, I assist many people to deal with every kind of problem while supporting my family." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy furniture and office equipment for her workplace.

loans.use: To buy furniture and office equipment for her legal advice center.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is a widower and has seven children.  None of his children is currently in school.  Simon has a small retail shop, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Simon hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and take care of himself.  In the future, Simon hopes to expand his business into a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Khishigjargal

texts.en:
Khishigjargal is a 37-year-old woman who trained as a professional plasterer. She lives with her husband and three kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is a student at university while the other two attends local secondary school. Khishigjargal has been operating a shoe-making and -retailing business since 1998, together with her husband. 

Khishigjargal sells their handmade shoes at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia.  Over the past years, they have gained a large number of customers from the countryside therefore they make shoes to order as well. Her husband makes handcrafted shoes together with one person while Khishigjargal runs the stall. The business profitability depends on the season yet the business goes well all the time.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to make more shoes for the spring and summer seasons. She is a hard-working woman who wants to provide her children with an excellent education. She is also one of our trusted clients.

loans.use: To make more shoes for spring and summer.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Tham T. H. is 41 years old with two children who are in high school. She has a shop that buys and sells old motorbikes.  Her business is running smoothly. Every month, she can sell five old motorbikes and that creates a stable income for her.  Being a client of our credit program since 2006, she has received loans seven times and has invested effectively in her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to use as capital when buying old motorbikes.

loans.use: to use as capital when she buys old motorbikes.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 31 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الفحم له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله يريد من خلال تطور العمل الى تأمين نفسه حتى يتمكن من بناء عائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كمية كبيرة من الفحم للمحل يلقى صعوبة بعدم توفر السيولة لتطوير العمل له زبائن من الجيران والمحيط
texts.en: Houssein is 31 years old and unmarried. He works in the selling of coal and has been doing this for five years. He loves his business and through its development he hopes to attain financial security for himself so that he may settle down and start his own family. With this loan he wants to purchase a large amount of coal for his store. He faces difficulty due to the lack of support available for business development. His customers are his neighbours and people living locally.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of coal for his store

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong T. V. is 54 years old with two children. One of them is married and the other has been at vocational school for two years. To have money for him to finish his studies, she opened a small grocery shop   right at her house. It developed more and more when she used money that she borrowed from our credit program to buy more new kinds of products to sell.  Therefore, she can earn 100,000 VND profit per day. 

Currently, her son is going to graduate from school and find a job. She needs to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy him a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy her son a motorbike.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang  H. T. N.  is 30 years old with two children who are attending secondary school. She has a shop that sells construction materials such as cement, steel, bricks, stone, etc. Her business creates 3,000,000 VND profit per month.  Receiving loans from our credit program since 2007, she has used them to buy more material to meet the demand of clients and always been in a good repayment situation. Currently, she needs to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy a mini truck for delivery.

loans.use: to buy a mini truck for delivery.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. T. N. is 25 years old with one child. She attended a training course on  creating hair style four years ago. Receiving our first loan in 2006, she opened a  hair salon with many services such as cutting hair, designing hair styles,  and providing other hair care services.  This salon attracts a lot of customers and creates a considerable income for her.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more hair care products to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more hair care products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and a mixed farmer in Kitale Town in Western Kenya. She is married with two children, aged 2 and 8 years. Her eggs are sold to the local market. Her grocery retail business in the local market compliments her farming income.

Leah has requested a loan of 42,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. This is her fourth loan request from Juhudi Kilimo. She says the income generated will complement her income from her poultry business and help her educate her children. She intends to purchase a motorbike to help in transporting her produce to the market.

Leah laments that the poor state of roads makes delivery to the market difficult and often results in income loss as produce goes bad. She is glad to be able to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase  and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anis

texts.ar: انيس في عمر 60 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في دهان الموبيليا له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويتطوره دائما يريد زيادة في المدخول حيث انه يلقى منافسة كبيرة من المحيط العمليله خبرة كبيرة في المصلحة ويتميز بالدقة والجد في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء موتور للرش + الواح ستانلس يحب ان يتطور له زبائن من محيطه يحب ان يصبح صاحب محل كبير للموبيليا هذه من طموحاته التي يريد تحقيقها
texts.en: Anis is 60 years old and married with four children. He works in furniture restoration and has 20 years experience in this. He loves his work and is always seeking to develop it. He wants to increase his income as he faces a lot of competition in his local area. He has a lot of experience, is hard-working and does his work with precision. With this loan he wants to purchase spray paint and stainless panels. He has customers from his local area. From amongst his dreams, he would like the be the owner of a large furniture store.

loans.use: to purchase spray paint and stainless panels for his furniture restoration business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with one child who attends school. For the past 4 years, Rose has been selling clothes from home, which contributes to her source of living. She also sells window curtains, adding to her income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of curtains and bed sheets to sell. Rose decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of curtains and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Mwamali

texts.en:
MwamA. is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a mason by profession and he supports the family's basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has sold firewood from home to her neighbors and passersby. MwamA. faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is married to a gymnastics teacher, but has no children. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Sera has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are the neighbors and passersby. Sera faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, the number of customers is higher compared to the months of January to May. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Sera decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase chemicals, hair pieces, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase hair pieces, hair weaves, chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with two boys; they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a traditional palm wine selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her local villagers. She was operating a food stall business before she started selling palm wine. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling to many customers in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to renovate her pub and purchase mugs for use in her pub. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her pub and purchase mugs for use in her pub.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is a married man. His wife helps him run their general store and they have six children aged between fourteen years old and five months old to whom they hope to give quality education to the university level. His business is located at  Kakamega-Kisumu road and he is served by the Kakamega branch. 

Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugarcane and normally referred as the "sugarbelt". Joseph owns a general store in which he sells such items as detergents, soft drinks, rice, sugar and others to the local people. He has been in this business for the last four years and has managed to give employment to one person. 

Joseph says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has are financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 35,000 to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He describes himself as self-motivated and determined.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, beverages and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Joline Niptial

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27ans célibataire sans enfants. Après son baccalauréat  elle débute son commerce en vendant des sandales en 2009. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock en achetant des sandales femmes et pour enfants.
Son ambition est de devenir grossiste auprès des détaillants. 
Elle souhaite devenir responsable afin de prendre soin de sa vie quotidienne et de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 27 years old, single, and has no children. After taking her baccalaureate, she started her business of selling sandals in 2009.  This loan will allow her to increase her stock of sandals for women and children.
 Her ambition is to be a wholesaler to retailers.  
She hopes to be responsible for taking care of her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's sandals

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.en:
J. Sherzod is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and raising livestock for the past seven years. He is married and has three children. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase cattle to sell. Sherzod is grateful to everyone supporting him.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.
