And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase calves to expand his business.

loans.name: Brice Alexandrine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29ans célibataire sans enfant. Elle débute son activité en 2000.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des sacs haricots, de riz, d’arachide, de sel, tomate,oignon. 

Sa stratégie est de renforcer sa marchandise à tout moment afin de satisfaire aux besoins des clients.

Elle aimerait être grossiste dans les jours futurs.
Son souhait est de réussir afin de mieux subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This client is 29 years old, single, and has no children.  She began her work in 2000. 
This loan will allow her to buy sacks of beans, rice, peanuts, salt, tomatoes and onions. 
Her strategy is to build up her stock of merchandise so that she can meet the needs of her customers at all times.  

She would like to be a wholesaler in the future. Her wish is to succeed so that she can better meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, salt, and  tomato concentrate

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer and he contributes to covering the family's basic needs with his income. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water.Eline's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food stall for the past six years, selling to her neighbours. Eline faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She purchases her inventory from Ukunda town. She dreams of expanding her business to greater heights.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to increase inventory, buying bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory with bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mavlonberdi

texts.en:
K. Mavlonberdi is 34 years old. He is married with two children. Mavlonberdi is selling cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market feeds them and then resells them at a higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for many years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. 

Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family. Mavlonberdi has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Today, knowing that the price for animals is not so high right now but will increase for sure, Mavlonberdi is planning to expand  his herd  and purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he requests a loan of 10,000 Somoni. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.fr:
Client de 31 ans célibataire sans enfant, a l'obtention de son Bac, n'ayant pas des moyens pour aller continuer des etudes universitaires , il se lance dans le commerce.
En 1998, il ouvre une boucherie ou il vend de la viande de bœuf,des cartons  de cuisses de poulets,les ailes de poulet, les cotis de porcs , du poisson de mer, ses ventes sont de 15.000fr a 30.000 fr par jour.

A l'obtention de son prêt, il compte renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en ajoutant, 5 cartons de viande bœuf,2 cartons de queue de bœuf,2 cartons de  cuisses de poulet, un cartons d'ailes de poulet et deux cartons de poisson de mer comme la morue et le poisson capitaine.
A l'avenir il veut être un grand homme d'affaire, ouvrir une chambre froide et faire vente en gros des cartons de vivres frais.
texts.en:
Mr. Frederic K. N. is a single 31-year-old entrepreneur with no children. Upon receipt of his high school diploma, not having the means to continue his studies at a university level, he went into business.

In 1998, he opened a butcher's shop where he sells beef, cartons of chicken thighs, chicken wings, pork chops and saltwater fish. His sales range from 15,000 to 30,000 CFA francs daily.

Upon receiving his loan, he plans to increase his available merchandise, adding 5 cartons of beef, 2 cartons of oxtail, 2 cartons of chicken thighs, a carton of chicken wings and 2 cartons of saltwater fish like cod and emperor fish.

In the future, he wants to be a serious businessman, open a cold storage room and sell cartons of fresh food wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cartons of beef, pork chops, boiling fowl, cartons of chicken thighs

loans.name: Zeina

texts.ar: زينه في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها 3 اولاد تحب عمله فهي تعمل في صنع المربيات والعطورات لها في عملها 15 سنة تتقن هذا العمل وتجيده كثيرا فهي طموحت مثابرة ومجتهدة في العمل تريد دائما التطور والتجدد تسعى من خلال تطوير عملها الى تحقيق حلمها بتوسيع العمل حتى يصبح متجر كبير تتلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة خاصة الزوج والأولاد لها تاريخ جيد تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لتصنيع المربيات والعطورات
texts.en: Zeina is 38 years old and married with three children. She makes jams and perfumes for a living and has 15 years experience in this. She loves her work and does it skilfully and with excellence. She is ambitious, persistent and hard-working and is always seeking to develop and renew her business. Through this development she hopes to achieve her dream of expanding her business into a big store. She has the full support of her family, especially her husband and children. She has good credit history with Al Majmoua. With this loan she wants to purchase more raw materials to make jams and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make jams and perfumes

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.en:
K. Umarjon is 36 years old. He is married with four children. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 15 years together with his wife. Umarjon would like to expand his business by adding more cattle to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. 

He is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. With additional income Umarjon will be better able to cater for his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his children.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to expand his herd.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
K. Mukaddas is a teacher of secondary school in Shahristan town. At the same time, in order to earn additional income, she is growing different vegetables with the help of her father. They work hard at growing vegetables, which they sell in the market. 

Last season was very good and after much effort, they achieved a big harvest. Her father went the market to sell the crop they had labored for. Currently Mukaddas’s family has a financial problem and she needs the help of all of us. 

The family’s desire is to continue planting vegetables and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seed and fertilizer. For this purpose, Mukaddas and her family are requesting a loan of $1800 USD, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.en:
K. Karimberdi is 60 years old. He is married with three children. Since he was young, Karimberdi has been working in the animal husbandry business. After he had gained much experience, Karimberdi decided to run an additional business and opened his own café with the help of his family. The whole family is engaged in this business. 

However, today he needs to expand his business and wants to purchase additional foodstuffs for his business. With the part of the loan, Karimberdi will also buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase  foodstuffs for his cafe and also calves.

loans.name: Elmurot

texts.en:
K. Elmurot is 36 years old. He is married with four children. Elmurot is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the most commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Elmurot requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his cows. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working in his buying and selling of animals.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Isimiso Group

texts.en:
Thandi is 53 years old and single with 7 children, aged 9,20,21,27,28 and 37. Only 1 attend school. In the photo above she is wearing a blue head scarf, standing in front of her group. She's been in this business for 8years and sells Pillows and clothes at the flee market in Mandini, South Africa. She has no other source of income. 
She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy Fabrics, pillows and clothes .She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes she does not get fabrics by the time she goes to buy and when it is being delivered to her the clients no longer buy her stuff. In five years' time she would like to buy herself a car and own a fabric shop.  

 She says that the extra income from this loan will her send her children to university. 
 
She  added that she have seen WDB and Kiva changing other people's lives from her area,so she decided to join so her life can change as well.

loans.use: To buy cotton, wool,  and needles.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim T., 53, is a villager in Shahristan town in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own a 0.5 hectare of land where they cultivate vegetables. They are also engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. On their plantation, they now face the obstacle of not having enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. Ibrohim is therefore requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop, as well as to buy young cattle.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International: 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is employed and provides the family with their basic needs. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past three years, Jane has operated a business selling brooms, both at the market and from door-to-door to her neighbors and to passersby. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kshs, Jane plans to purchase brooms for resale. She decided to work with Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase brooms for resale

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married with six school-going children. She owns a house that lacks both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over 20 years, she has operated a business selling brooms, both at the market and from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In the future, Mjeni dreams of expanding her business in order to improve her standard of living.

With the loan of 30,000 Kshs, Mjeni plans to purchase brooms for resale. She joined Yehu in order to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase brooms for resale

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is married and has a son. For a long time, she had several different jobs and then realized that her best opportunity would be to run her own business. Today, Hafiza has a business selling women's clothing in the local market and she has been in this trade for six years.

Hafiza is very sociable and her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation in the market. She has also proven to be a good manager of her finances, promptly repaying all of her loans from IMON International.

Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Hafiza's business. She is now requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes the loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion. Profit generated by her business will help Hafiza cover some necessities at home in order to improve her family's quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase clothing to increase the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Reachel

texts.en: Reachel, 35, is a dairy farmer. For extra income, she also farms crops. She started dairy farming after receiving capital from Faulu Kenya and has now been running her business for three years. With the income she generates, she is able to raise her child. Reachel hopes to become a prosperous farmer in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with two children, who both attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. James' wife is a lecturer and she contributes to her family's basic needs.

James has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing a supermarket in the future. James plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of sugar, rice and maize flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Banju

texts.en:
Banju is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and paraffin.

He has been operating a business for one year, selling goats to butchers on a wholesale basis. Banju faces a major challenge in the seasonal nature of his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 of his loan, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Mdune

texts.en:
Mdune is a married man with two school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a bicycle spare parts shop for the past five years. His potential customers are the local neighbours. The major challenge that Mdune faces in his business is theft. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 of his loan, he wants to purchase tyres, spokes, and steel bolts. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase tyres, spokes, and steel bolts.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is single with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hadija has operated a vegetable stall for the past 10 months, selling at retail prices to her local neighbors. Hadija faces a major challenge of high transportations costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her food stall in the future.

Hadija plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, mangoes, onions and bananas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of assorted vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Husein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 50 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في تنجيد المفروشات له في عمله 35سنة يحب عمله ويريد التجدد والتطور يريد تأمين عيش كريم له ولعائلته هو نشيط وله خبرة كبيرة في عمله يحلم بالتوسع والتطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة لدعم المصلحة من خشب وماكنة خياطة وغيره
texts.en: Husein is 50 years old, and married with a son. He works in furniture upholstery and has 35 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop and renew it. He wants to secure a comfortable life for himself and his family. He is energetic and has a lot of experience in his work. He hopes to expand and develop his business. With this loan he wants to purchase new goods such as wood and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase new goods such as wood and a sewing machine for his furniture upholstery business.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion W. N. is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  For the past seven years, she has been offering funeral services.  She has been earning her living from this business and she is able to educate her children.  She previously sold veterinary products.  After she joined Faulu Kenya, she managed to expand her business and she has built her own home.   She hopes to build rental houses and expand her business in the future.  She is requesting a loan for 70,000 KES to pay school fees for her brother.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 45 years old, married, and has three children aged between the ages of 10 and 15. Her business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is in the western part of Kenya. The major activity in the area is sugarcane farming and it is known as the sugar belt region. Margaret owns a grocery kiosk in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. She has been in this business for the past five years. She states that her business is profitable and the major challenge she faces is the harassment from the local administration. She is requesting a  loan of 20,000 KES to buy more groceries to expand her business. She also plans to use the remainder of the money to purchase a cow from which she will be getting milk. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She also hopes to give all her children a quality education to the university level. She describes herself as very focused and intelligent.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and a cow

loans.name: Khayralah

texts.ar: خيرالله في عمر 24 سنة يعمل في صنع وبيع مواد التنظيف له في عمله 8 سنوات متجول يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لتصنيع مواد التنظيف وزيادة البضائع له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه عمله متقن وجيد يحب ان يطور عمله بحيث يستطيع ان يبيع بالجملة
texts.en: Khayrala is 24 years old and works in the selling of cleaning materials. He has 8 years experience from other various places of emploment. He loves his business and wants to develop it and secure a good future for himself. With this loan he wants to buy raw materials to make cleaning products as well as purchase more stock. He has customers from his locality and from his neighbours and relatives. He does his work well and with excellence and hopes to develop and expand to enter the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and purchase more stock for his cleaning products sales business

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.ar: ابتسام في عمر 36 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والمشروبات والخردوات لها في عملها 10 سنوات متزوجة ولها ثلاث اولاد تحب عملها وهي تعتمد على نفسها في تربية اولادها في الانفاق عليهم تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولعائلتها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كارت لخطوط الهواتف النقالة لكي يصبح عندها مدخول اضافي لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكانت تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وهي نشيطة ومثابرة وتحب العمل والاعتماد على الذات
texts.en: Ebtisam is 36 years old and works in a grocery store selling food and drink items and vegetables. She has 10 years experience in this. She is married and has three children. She loves her work and independently raises and provides for her three children. She wants to secure a good future for herself and her family. With this loan she wants to purchase mobile phone credits to sell so that she has some additional income. She has good credit history with Al Majmoua and has full support from her family. She is enthusiastic, persistent and loves her business and being independent.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone credits to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is 52 years old. She is married and has six children. To make a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years. Previously, she grew beans and maize for her living. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business by adding more stock. She hopes to expand her shop into a supermarket in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to add to her stock of cooking fat, sugar, salt, and maize flour.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking fat, sugar, salt, and maize flour.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 55 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في صيانة وتركيب الادوات الصحية له في عمله 46 سنة يحب عمله ويتقنه جيدا يريد دائما التطور في العمل فهو يحب عائلته ويريد مساعدتها على تخطي مصاعب العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى مساعدة ابنه في تكملة بناء منزله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وساهم في زيادة مدخوله وشراء الات جديدة للعمل
texts.en: Hassan is 55 years old and married with three children. He works in the field of maintaining and installing plumbing components. He's worked in this field for 46 years and he likes his work, which he performs well. He is constantly trying to develop his business because he loves his family and wants to help them overcome the difficulties they have in their professionA. lives. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, Hassan would like to help his son finish constructing his home. Hassan has a good credit history with A.-Majmoua as he received the full support of his family during his last loan, which he used to increase his income by buying new tools for his work.

loans.use: to help his son finish constructing his house

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface A. is 28 years old and married. He and his wife have one child aged two years old, whom they wish to give a quality education, up to the university level. His business is located at Khayega in Kakamega, and it is known by the name Jakaka Bakeries. Kakamega is in the western part of Kenya. The major activity in the area is sugarcane farming, and it is well known as the sugar belt region. Bonface owns a small bakery in which he sells doughnuts, halfcakes and other baked products to the local people. He has been in this business for the last four years and has four employees. He says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more flour and oil to expand his business and meet the demands of his customers. He plans to expand his business to a big bakery. He describes himself as focused and determined.

loans.use: to buy more flour and oil.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 42 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل سائق لنقل الطلاب والسواح له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويريد من خلال العمل الى تطوير نفسه فهو متجدد ومحب للعمل والنشاط يريد ان يزيد مدخوله حتى يستطيع تأمين العيش الجيد للأولاد وان يدخل مصلحة جديدة له كي تعيله على تخطي مصاعب الحياة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بقرة والاستفادة من بيع الحليب واللبن وغيره من مشتقاتها والاستفادة منها بزيادة مدخوله
texts.en: Mohammad is 42 years old and married with five children. He works as a driver for students and tourists. He has worked in this capacity for 13 years, and he likes his work. He would like to develop himself through his work, as he is forward-thinking and loves working, as well as being active in generA.. He would like to increase his income in order to be able to secure a good life for his children and to help himself overcome the various difficulties in his life. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, Muhammad would like to buy a cow so that he may increase his income by selling the dairy products that the cow will produce.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase the family income

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 28 years old and married, with one child. He earns his daily bread by dairy farming. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and also does poultry farming for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He hopes to expand his business and become the best farmer in Kiambu. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man and is living with his wife. He has previous experience of 8 years in the construction field. In 2007, he started to work independently in response to customers' demands. He is a talented concrete carpenter with a good business reputation. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. He is the only income source of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He is very positive about his future plans.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ar: جميلة في عمر 46 سنة متزوجة ولها 3 اولاد تعمل في بيع الالبسة لها في عملها 6 سنوات تحب العمل وهي نشيطة ومثابرة في العمل تريد تأمين العيش الكريم للعائلة وتطوير نفسها ماديا واجتماعيا تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع موسمية للعمل وتزيد من مدخول المحل لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة هي تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة تحب ان تعمل بنشاط وان تكون منتجة وخاصة ان تعول اولادها
texts.en: Jamila is 46 years old and married with three children. She works in selling clothes. She has six years of experience in her field and she likes her work. She is very active and dilligent in her work. She would like to secure a respectable life for her family as well as improve her own material situation and social position. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she plans to buy seasonal clothing for her store, and in doing so, increase her store's income. She has a good history with al-Majmoua and has received full support from her family in applying for this loan. She likes to work hard and to be productive, especially in order to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her clothing store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a married mother of three school-going children, one boy and two girls, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has operated a clothing business for the past four years, selling at the market and from home to neighbours and passersby. She decided to join Yehu to access loans easily, and with a loan of Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas - Kenyan women's attire. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, and during rainy season transportation becomes a challenge. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying in large quantities in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 52 years old and married with one child.  She has been selling detergent and clothes since 1999.  She has managed to educate her child with the funds she gets from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to expand her business premises and add more clothing stock in the future. With the 50,000 Kes, she will buy chemicals to make detergent, and clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to make detergent, and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nouh

texts.ar: نوح متزوج وله اربع اولاد عمره 31 سنة يعمل في بلاط المنازل وتركيب الحجر الصخري للديكور له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويتقنه بشكل جيد يريد لعائلته العيش الكريم الرغيد من خلال تطوير نفسه وعمله وهو دائم التطور والتقدم وملاحقة كل ما هو جديد من ديكور وغيره يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شحن بضائع جديدة من ايطاليا لأنه يريد التحديث في العمل له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد لقي الدعم الكامل له خبرة واسعة في عمله وله زبائن من مختلف المناطق المجاورة له
texts.en: Noah is 31 years old and married with four children. He works in the field of installing tiled floors and decorative stonework. He has 20 years of experience in his field and likes his work. He performs his work very well. He wants his family to have a comfortable and respectable life, and he wishes to achieve this by developing himself and his business. He is always advancing in his work and improving his business as he constantly follows the developments in home decor and stonework. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he hopes to purchase new materials from Italy in order to keep his business up-to-date. He has a good history with al-Majmoua, and he has received the full support of his family in applying for this loan. He has a lot of experience in his field, and he has customers in many areas.

loans.use: to purchase new up-to-date tile and stone from Italy

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé depuis le début des activités du Banc Villageois en 2000. Il est composé de 12 femme qui sont toutes du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. GUEYE

Madame BIGUE D. (debout à droite de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du groupe de solidarité depuis sa formation au jour d'inauguration du Banc Villageois

Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers, tels du mil, du riz, de l'arachide et des noix d'acajou. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans.

Son crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises citée ci-dessus

Son objectif est de soutenir son marie dans la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom solidarity group  as created after the launching of Banc Villageois in 2000. The group is composed of 12 women from the same village. They are neighbors and fiends who organized a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of TouB. Gueye.

Mrs. Bigue D. (standing to the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group’s leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She has been a member of the solidarity group since the group’s creation on the day when Banc Villageois was inaugurated. She retails various products, such as millet, rice, peanuts and cashew nuts. She has been in this line of business for over ten years.

Her loan will allow her to increase her level of stock in buying more of the merchandises mentioned above. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family needs, for example, the cost of food, education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase millet, peantus, rice and cashew nuts

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old and married with two children. He has been operating a bodaboda (motorbike) transport business for five years. He also sells electronic goods for extra income. He has used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to improve his business and hopes to open a wholesale shop in Kiambu town in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of electronic goods.

loans.use: To stock electronic goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives alone. He has owned a car repair shop since 2004 and has 10 years of experience working in the same occupation. He is a hard worker and an ambitious man. He has lots of loyal customers passing by his shop because of his first-rate services. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional mechanical equipment that will facilitate his business operation and increase his productivity. In the future, he is planning to further develop his work efficiency.

loans.use: purchase additional mechanical equipment

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
For over seven years, Mwanasha has been selling cloth materials, bed sheets, and khangas (fabric for traditional wrap-around dresses) from door to door. She started the business to have a form of employment and income for the family. She sells to her local neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation of materials to her place of operation. 

With this loan, she will purchase bed sheets, khangas and second-hand clothes to increase her inventory of products to sell and so increase her earnings. Her dream is to be able to establish a shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets, fabrics, and second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a member of Shalom Self Help Group under Faulu Kenya. He joined the group so that he could save his money and access loans easily. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He also started running a motorbike transport business after getting capital from Faulu Kenya. Daniel is also a farmer who grows tea. He hopes to expand his shop into a supermarket in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kes to enlarge his retail shop.

loans.use: To enlarge his retail shop

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.ar: هنادي في عمر 35 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان تعمل في صالون للحلاقة نسائي لها في عملها 3 سنوات تحب عملها وجيده ترغب في تحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وتطوير عملها فهي نشيطة محبة للعمل تعمل بنشاط وحيوية لها خبرة في عملها تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى تحديث قسم جديد لتأجير الفساتين الخاصة بالسهرات + شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل مثل الشامبو وغيره هنادي تساعد عائلتها على تطوير نفسها فهي مجدة في طلب التقدم في العمل والحياة
texts.en: Hanadi is 35 years old and married with two children. She works in a women's hair salon, which she owns. She has owned her store for three years. She likes her work and has come to do it very well. She would like to improve her material and social position by developing her business, as she is an active woman who likes to work. She works very hard, and she has experience in her field. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to both update the new section in her store where she rents out evening gowns, and buy new supplies for her store, such as shampoo. Through her seriousness about improving her personal and professional life, Hanadi helps her family develop themselves as well

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her hair salon as well as buy new rental dresses for the dress-rental section of her salon

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKU LIGUEY est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de TOUBA GUEYE qui abrite ledit groupe. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles sont toutes actives dans le domaine du petit commerce. 

Madame Déguène D. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend du mil et des noix d'acajou grillés et décortiqués. Elle a une bonne expérience dans la vente de mil et de noix d'acajou pour l'avoir pratiquée de puis plus de 05 ans. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins 10 sacs de 50 kg de mil et des noix d'acajou qu'elle va griller et décortiquer avant de les revendre dans les marchés. 

Son objectif est d'acheter de la nourriture (riz, huile, lait etc.) pour la famille, et acheter éventuellement des médicaments en cas de maladie d'un membre de la famille
texts.en:
The Taku Liguey solidarity group has been created at the launch of the Banc Villageois of Tobua Gueye to which this group belongs. The group is composed of 10 women from the same village. They all work as vendors. 

Mrs. Déguène D. (standing to the far right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 23 years of age. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. She is a vendor. She sells millet and cashew nuts, shelled and roasted. She has a good experience selling millet and cashew nut, as she has been doing this for over five years. Her loan will allow her to purchase at least ten 50-kg bags of millets and nuts, which she is going to shell and roast before reselling at the market. Her goal is to be able to buy food (rice, oil, milk etc) for her family, and also have enough money to purchase medications should one of her family members fall ill.

loans.use: to purchase ten 50-kg bags of millet and cashew nuts

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Bernard is a blacksmith who does welding to earn his living. He has been in the business for two years. He also raises pigss to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances and his business at large. He hopes to expand and open other outlets in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en: This is a 34 years-old Abu Bakarr. He is married, and has 2 children aged 8 and 13 years old. He has 2 additional dependents. In 2007, Abu bakarr established his Pharmacy business. He began this business because he wants to be self employed as a result of poor salary structure in other institutions he has been working for. I decided to open a pharmacy to make more profit and be able to take care of my wife and children said. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, Abu Bakar earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000. Abu Bakarr requires a loan in order to purchase more pharmaceutical drugs. In the future, I plan to make life comfortable for my children by way of building a home and to give quality education to them.   I thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 44 سنة متزوج يعمل في مطعم لبيع الفول والحمص وهو طعام لبناني يحب عمله له خبرة كبيرة في هذا العمل له في عمله 10 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساعده في تطوير نفسه وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع منزله وتطويره حتى يصبح في مستوى معيشته
texts.en: Hussein is 44 years old and married. He works in a restaurant selling Lebanese food such as fuul (beans) and hummus. He loves his work and has 10 years experience in this. He has good credit history with A. Majmoua and previous loans helped him to develop his business further. He has the full support of his family. With this loan he wants to improve and renovate his house so that it may be suitable to live in.

loans.use: to renew and renovate his house to make it suitable for living in.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase firewood and start a charcoal business

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a 39-year-old dairy farmer who has been farming for the past ten years. She also sells secondhand clothes to supplement her family’s income. Winnie hopes to expand her business to attract more customers in the future. She has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, (20,17); la socia es comerciante minorista, la socia vende productos de belleza por catálogos, ella tiene un pequeño almacén en casa en el cual ella almacena los productos de belleza que la socia compra en oferta para después de un tiempo poderlos ofrecer a un poco mas y como deja en dos partes el producto, las clientes que tiene le compran; la socia también viaja y trae ropa de la cuidad de Lima, ella vende todo tipo de ropa; La socia requiere el crédito para comprar ropa y productos de belleza para la venta. La socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de ropa y la compra de productos en oferta.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana, 51, is a member of the “AMAUTA” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She’s married and has two children who are 20 and 17 years of age.  She is a Retailer.  She sells beauty products via catalogue.  She has a small warehouse at home where she stores the beauty items she buys on sale which after some time she resells at a slightly higher price and, because she collects payments in two parts, her customers buy from her.  She also travels and brings clothes from Lima.  She sells all types of clothes.  She needs this loan to buy clothes and beauty products to sell.  She is requesting the loan to buy clothes and beauty products that are on sale.

She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion

loans.use: to buy clothing on sale.

loans.name: Nolwazi Group

texts.en:
Ncamsile, 39 years old, is married with 5 children, aged 10 months, 8, 9, 13 and 18, four of whom attend school. In the photo above, she is wearing a white shirt. Ncamsile has been making and selling mats for 3 years from her home in Mandini, South Africa. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant.

Ncamsile requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy cotton, wool and needles. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who buy on credit and end up not paying. In five years time, Ncamsile would like to own a craft center and teach the community youth to make crafts as well. She says that the extra income from this loan will  pay for school fees and to extend her house. She hopes that WDB will continue helping them with more loans.

loans.use: to buy wool, cotton and needles

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي في عمر 47 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل سائق فان لنقل الطلاب له في عمله 3 سنوات يرى ان عمله هو مصدر مهم للرزق فهو يريد تطوير عمله من خلال تحسين وضع الفان خاصته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان وتوفير بعض المال يحب العمل يريد تأمين العيش الكريم لعائلته له زبائن منم جيرانه ومحيطه حيث انه مقصد للكثير من الزبائن
texts.en: Ali is 47 years old and married with a son. He works as a van driver transporting schoolchildren and has been doing this for 3 years. He considers this work an important source of provision for himself and wants to develop it by improving the condition of his van. With this loan he wants to perform maintenance work on his vehicle and save some money. He loves his job and wants to secure a comfortable life for his family. His customers range from his neighbours and others from his locality. He is the only such service provider for many of them.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van and save some money

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. He has been working as a tailor for 8 years.  This competent young man was able to open his own tailoring shop in 2008. He is well known by members of his town. He delivers his products to local clothing stores. He is the main income source of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new textiles in addition to tailoring tools in order to increase his sales and therefore his income. He has high hopes for the future and is keen to earn higher profits so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new textiles and tailoring tools.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is 43 years old and is blessed with two children, aged 5 and 10.  His wife assists him in running his retail shop and grocery store. Kenneth has operated the business for nearly five years but was previously employed. He started pig farming after he got his first loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to own a wholesale business in the future. Kenneth plans to use this 50,000 KES loan to open another retail shop to get more customers.

loans.use: to open another retail shop

loans.name: Marta Rubidia

texts.es:
Doña Marta, de 54 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, donde vive con su esposo y un hijo, el negocio que administra es la venta de ropa nueva y artículos escolares, aprendió por sus familiares y luego se independizo, teniendo en la actualidad 16 años de ser comerciante en ropa y artículos escolares.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería tanto ropa como material escolar, con la intención de mantener el inventario surtido para los clientes,.
Su aspiración es ir en aumento con los negocios, mejorar la atención a los clientes así mismo las ventas, que su familia tenga estabilidad económica y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marta is 54 years old and she resides in Puerto el Triunfo with her husband and their son. The business that she has is one selling new clothing and school supplies. He learned it from family members and later she opened an independent business of her own. She now has 16 years in the business selling clothing and school supplies.

She requests a loan to purchase clothing as well as school supplies with the goal of maintaining variety in the inventory for her clients.

Her goal is to increase her business, to improve her service to clients, and to improve her sales so that her family will have financial stability and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more material

loans.name: Lilian Isabel

texts.es:
Lilian  D. 37 años, resiD. en Lolotiquillo departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo junto a sus hijos: Leydi D. 15 años, Elmer D. 12 años, Manrique D. 9 años y Mercedes D. 7 meses D. edad. Lilian se dedica a la venta D. pupusas, la cual realiza en su casa cinco días a la semana, tiene aproximadamente ocho meses D. dedicarse a este oficio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes y mesas D. madera, esta inversión  le ayudara no solo para la producción sino para la comodidad en la atención D. los clientes, pues contara con mobiliario en buenas condiciones, dando un mejor servicio y mejores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones D. Lilian son que su negocio sea capaz D. atender a muchos clientes, que su familia prospere económicamente y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Lilian is 37 years old and she lives in Lolotiquillo in the department of Morazan. She lives with her husband and their children: Leydi is 15 years old, Elmer is 12, Manrique is 9, and Mercedes is 7 months old. Lilian sells pupusas, a business she carries out from her home five days a week. She has been in business approximately eight months.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients and wooden tables. This investment will help her in production but also in the attention and comfort of her clients. She will have a well furnished business, providing better service and thereby improving her earnings.

Lilian's goal is to have a business that is able to cater to many clients, to have her family prosper financially and to let her children go to school to prepare for the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and wooden tables

loans.name: Adela Ignacia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Adela; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, (todos ellos independientes); la socia es cesante de Salud, ella es una mujer llena de vida y muy dulce, la socia actualmente se dedica a realizar bellos y finos trabajos a mano, la socia hace manualidades, como bisutería (aretes, collar, pulseras), artesanía (trabajos decorativos), cocina a pedido puede realizar todo tipo de platos para toda ocasión. La socia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para poder comprar todos los materiales para las manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adela, 65, is a member of the “AMAUTA” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She’s married and has three children; all independent.  She is a retired Health Care Worker.  She’s a very sweet woman who’s full of life.  She’s currently engaged in making beautiful, fine, handmade handicrafts like costume jewelry (earrings, necklaces, bracelets), crafts (decorative items), food to order, because she can make dishes for all occasions.  She needs a loan on this occasion to buy all her materials and supplies for her crafts.  She requests the loan to buy materials.

She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Rosemberg

texts.es: Rosemberg G. de 20 años es un joven emprendedor y muy estudioso, que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas  en su negocio llamado “Donde Rosemberg”, el cual inició hace dos años vendiendo deditos por bandejas; como es muy estudioso y proyectado al futuro,   hizo un curso de comidas rápidas y acudió a la ayuda de su padre, quien le facilitó un dinero con el cual  compró su carro de perros calientes y algunas sillas;   fue así como empezó a incluir entre sus comidas rápidas, perros calientes , salchipapas, hamburguesas, picadas de carne asada y de pollo; en la actualidad  lo ayuda un familiar y aprovecha el punto para vender también minutos a celulares que son otro ingreso mas; él realiza sus compras de contado y esta decidido a crecer permanentemente, por eso acude a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues necesita hacer mejoras a su carro de perros y comprar materias primas para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Rosemberg está muy orgulloso de su negocio porque le ha ayudado a pagar su universidad y está concentrado en hacerse un profesional del derecho y fortalecer su estilo empresarial logrando modernizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosemberg G., 20, is a young, studious, entrepreneur.  He makes and sells fast food in his business called “Donde Rosenberg.” He started two years ago selling deditos (cookies) by the tray.  However, because he’s very curious and forward looking he took a fast food preparation course and asked his father for help.  His father gave him the money to buy a hotdog cart and some chairs.   

This is how he started to include hotdogs, salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage), hamburgers and grilled meat and chicken skewers to his fast food.  A relative currently helps him with the work.  He also takes advantage of his sales point to sell minutes of cell phone air time which is an additional source of income.  He pays cash for his purchases and is determined to grow permanently.  This is why he’s asking Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first loan because he needs to do some improvements on his hotdog cart and buy raw materials to increase his working capital.

Rosemberg is very proud of his business because it’s helped him pay his university expenses.  He is concentrating on becoming a Lawyer and to strengthening his business style trough modernization.

loans.use: to improve his hotdog cart and to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Don Samuel, de 40 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposa  y tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, tienen casa propia desde hace 16 años, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, la agricultura la inicio hace 11 años y la ganadería hace 5 años, este es el trabajo de don Samuel al que le dedica su tiempo y del cual recibe los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar maíz, este préstamo la ayudara a adquirir el abono y fertilizantes para dar los cuidados necesarios a la milpa.
Don Samuel espera que esta siembra le de buenos frutos, una cosecha abundante.
texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and he lives in Usulutan. He lives with his wife and their three children, aged 17, 14, and 11 years old. They have had their own house for 16 years. He is an agriculturist and farmer. He started his agriculture business 11 years ago and the farming business 5 years ago. This is the business that Samuel dedicates his time to and through which he earns the income necessary to cover the household needs. 

He request a loan to purchase materials to plant corn. This loan will help him acquire fertilizers and to provide the necessary maintenance to the plantation. Samuel hopes that this cultivation will have a good yield, an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicia Q. tiene 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijas bajo su dependencia, Felicia es madre soltera ya que su esposo se fue y la abandonó; ellas viven solas en la localidad de Quillacollo donde  tiene su actividad de venta de ropa al mayor y menor, esta ropa es nueva y usada, que la trae a veces del departamento de Santa Cruz. 

Felicia compra la ropa de directamente de los que confeccionan por docenas y las revende a veces a precios más elevados y si lo vende por unidad obtiene más utilidad, en las épocas de ferias viaja a Santa Cruz a vender su mercadería y vuelve con otra mercadería para poder comercializar, es asi que siempre está buscando obtener más utilidad y mejores ingresos apara su familia.

Es así que Felicia, en su afán de buscar mejores posibilidades para generar mejores ingresos se apersono a solicitar un crédito y tener un  capital de trabajo  por lo cual se le hizo una evaluación y se ve que es una persona que trabaja mucho para el bien de su familia. Felicia desea que con este crédito poder terminar de pagar el colegio de sus hijas y que ellas sean personas trabajadores y de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicia Q., 36, has two daughters in her care.  She’s a single mother who was abandoned by her husband.  She and her daughters live alone in Quillacollo.  She sells clothes at wholesale and retail.  The clothing is both new and used that she brings sometimes from Santa Cruz Department.

Felicia buys the clothes by the dozen directly from manufacturers and resells sometimes at higher prices.  If she sells by the piece she earns more profits.  During market she goes to Santa Cruz to sell her merchandise and returns with other merchandise to sell.  This is how she’s always seeking ways to obtain more profits and better income for her family.

Felicia, in her zeal to find better possibilities to improve income, came by in person to request a loan to have working capital.  An evaluation was conducted and it’s clear that she is a woman who works very hard for her family’s wellbeing.  Felicia wants to use this loan to finish paying school costs for her daughters so that they will become hard working, upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to finish paying school costs for her daughters.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia es cesante de Educación de primaria, y en la actualidad la socia se encuentra trabajando con la venta de productos de Salud, Omnilife; La socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para niños, la socia es una mujer alegre y junto a sus hermana trabajan juntas y comparten todos sus días y como nos comenta, le gusta reunirse con sus amigas en este grupo y siempre es grato verse y algunas ocasiones ellos se reúnen para cenar, la socia es una mujer que goza de un buen sentido del humor y se la encuantra siempre riendo y haciendo bromas; este banco comunal está integrado por socios disciplinados y llenos de mucho entusiasmo por la vida. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar sus productos y mercadería para vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar y abastecer su s negocios.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 65 years old and single.  She used to be an elementary school teacher and is currently working selling Omnilife health products.  She also buys and sells children's clothes.  Carmen is a cheerful woman and, together with her sister, she works and shares every day.  She tells us that she likes to meet with her friends in the community bank.  It is always nice to see each other and sometimes they get together to have supper.  Carmen is a woman with a good sense of humor and she is always laughing and joking.  The members of this community bank are all disciplined and full of zest for life.

Carmen would like a loan so that she can buy products and merchandise to sell.  She is requesting this loan to buy products and stock her businesses.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products and stock her businesses

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel S. de 51 años y es un emprendedor muy creativo, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa y su hijo de 11 años de edad; allí se dedica a la preparación y venta de arroz de pollo desde hace seis meses, negocio que inició cuando quedó sin empleo y de él afloró su espíritu empresarial, al que fue agregando,  el servicio de alquiler de triciclos por tarifas a vendedores que tienen puestos de venta, como actualmente lo hace. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el  comprará un triciclo y materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, porque con ello  aspira  a obtener una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 9% y fortalecer su poco capital de trabajo, el cual es indispensable para seguir creciendo con mayor rapidez y para lograr el sueño de tener algún día su casa propia y conseguir que su hijo se eduque en la universidad.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel S., 51, is a very creative entrepreneur living in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and 11-year-old son.  For the last six months he has been working making chicken with rice to sell.  He started this business when he lost his job and his entrepreneurial spirit flowered.  He started to add to it.  He now rents tricycles out to vendors who have stands.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy a tricycle and raw materials and ingredients in large volume because this way he hopes to get a 9% profit on sales and strengthen his working capital a bit which is indispensible for continued, quicker growth and to reach his goal of one day owning a house and being able to send his son to university.

loans.use: to buy a trycicle and raw materials and ingredients in large amounts.

loans.name: Noris Teresa

texts.es: Noris A. de 53 años es una habitante del barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana,  proyecto de autoconstrucción  liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace mas de 20 años. Ella se dedica a l oficio de la confección, como es tradicional en su historia familiar, aptitud que se hizo mas notoria,  dese que compró su primera máquina y empezó su vida en la costura, como una actividad generadora de ingresos, con la que no solo se distaría y alegraba su vida, sino que  apoyaba la gestión de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su hijo actualmente en la edad de 21 años. Esta idea de ser ella misma su “patrona” le gustó a Noris y por eso decidió hacerla crecer, así fue como acudió a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , organización con la que logró aumentar el volumen de sus compras y tener inventarios de productos de confecciones que ofrecer permanentemente a sus clientes. Este es su segundo financiamiento, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como hilos, botones, telas en general, correderas, y pellones. Con su credikiva logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo aun mas,  y también resolver sus desafíos asociados a la competencia de ropa extranjera desde el país vecino país de Panamá. Ella prevee que apoyada en sus financiamientos puede comprar en mayor cantidad con mejores precios y obtener telas e insumos mas modernos y de mayor calidad, y sacar una producción  con la que aspira a seguir sosteniendo su margen de utilidad que está en un36%.
texts.en:
Noris A. is 53 years old and lives in Ciudadela Metropolitana neighborhood, a self-build project started by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo more than 20 years ago.  Noris has a dressmaking business.  This skill is traditional in her family and hers became evident when she bought her first sewing machine and started working in the sewing business as a way of making income.  This work was not only enjoyable but also enabled her to support her household which is made up of her husband and her son who is currently 21 years old.  Noris liked the idea of being her own boss and so she decided to grow her business by taking her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With their help, she managed to increase her purchase volume and ensure that she permanently had products in stock to offer her customers.

This is Noris' second loan and she will use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as threads, buttons, general fabrics, zippers and fleece.  With the help of her Kiva loan, she will manage to increase her working capital even more and meet challenges associated with competition from foreign clothes coming from the neighboring country of Panama.  She predicts that with the support of her loans she will be able to buy in larger quantities, obtaining better prices and more modern and better-quality fabrics and supplies.  She will achieve a level of production that she hopes will enable her to continue maintaining her profit margin of 36%.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as threads, buttons, general fabrics, zippers and fleece

loans.name: Maria Ximena

texts.es: La señora María es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pollo al espiedo y caldos de pollo. Tiene una tienda en la avenida cuidad del niño de la zona de Pampahasi que se encuentra a veinticinco minutos del centro de la cuidad de la paz. La señora María tiene dos hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y la menor que esta en edad escolar vive con ella.     María tiene la actividad de venta de pollos desde hace dos años y actualmente tiene varios clientes ya que María es una buena cocinera y prepara deliciosos platos de pollo. Su hija menor es la persona que la ayuda más en la atención de la tienda, ya que después de sus clases de colegio va a la tienda de su madre para ayudar. Uno de los mayores anhelos de María es ampliar su negocio para tener más clientes y de esta manera poder ahorrar dinero para comprar una casa y permitir que su hija tenga acceso a una buena educación para ser un día una profesional. Con el dinero del credito comprara material de construccion para poder ampliar su tienda y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes,  La Sra. María esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora María is a hardworking woman who earns her living selling roast chicken and chicken soup. She has a store in Cuidad del Niño Avenue in the centre of La Paz.  

María has two children; the elder has already left home and the younger attends school and lives with her. She has had her business for two years, and her customers say that she is a good cook and prepares delicious chicken dishes. Her younger daughter helps her in the store after classes are over. 

One of María’s biggest wishes is to expand her business and have more customers. That way she can save money to buy a house and provide her daughter with a good education so she can get a good job one day. With the loan money she will buy construction material to expand the store and provide better service to her customers.

María is grateful to Kiva partner Emprender for the support that it provides.

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Belquiz

texts.es:
Belkis A. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, vísceras y otros, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años . Belkis inició su negocio desde hace 7 años, cuando su cónyuge empezó a trabajar como operario en un matadero de ganado ubicado en un municipio cercano y su buen desempeño lo llevó a ser secretario de una agremiación de matarifes; desde esta actividad puedo conseguir carne a un buen precio y trasladárselos a sus clientes de una manera competitiva. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, referidos y familiares que conocen la calidad y la seguridad del producto que ella vende. En la actualidad aspira a su primer credikiva con el cual comprará carne en mayor volumen con un capital a bajo costo, pues anteriormente dependía de un capital informal a muy alto costo el que planea reemplazar totalmente, para que su financiación sea exitosa y lograr el progreso de negocio. 
Belkis como madre, esposa y mujer trabajadora, tiene muchos sueños asociados a su familia, entre los cuales está el de tener su casa propia, ofrecer una educación de calidad a sus hijos y cumplir a corto plazo con una meta puntual y es la de comprarles un computador para que estén modernizados  desde su infancia.
texts.en:
Belkis A. lives in the town of Barranquilla and earns her living selling meat and offal from the house where she lives with her husband and their two children aged 2 and 7. She started her business seven years ago when her husband began work as an operator in a slaughterhouse located in a nearby municipality. 

Through hard work Belkis became secretary of the union of slaugherhouse workers. She was able to obtain meat cheaply and then sell it to her customers at competitive prices. Her customers are her neighbours, relatives, and people who are referred to her. They know that the meat she sells is of good quality and safe. 

She is now seeking her first loan which she will use to buy meat in larger quantities and thus at low prices. Before she had to borrow money at high interest rates. She hopes that her application will be successful so her business can progress. 

As a mother, wife, and hardworking woman, Belkis has many dreams regarding her family. She wishes to have a house of her own, to provide her children with a good education, and in the near future buy a computer so that her children grow up in the modern world.

loans.use: to buy meat in large quantities

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Adelma; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia tiene 2 hijos de 28 y 26 años de edad; La socia es docente de secundaria, la socia trabaja en el colegio de varones, el glorioso Ciencias; la socia está en el horario de la tarde, la socia también alterna su trabajo con un pequeño negocio independiente, ella compra y vende ropa de niños. La socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa para niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para niños y venta.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adelma is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Adelma is 65 years old, married, and has two children aged 28 and 26.  She is a high school teacher and works afternoons in a boys' school, the 'Glorioso Colegio Nacional de Ciencias'.  She divides her time between this work and a small independent business in which she buys and sells children's clothes.

Adelma needs this loan to invest in buying children's clothes to sell.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Agnes has been buying and selling cassava flour for twenty years. She started out with 100,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX. Her hardships include seasonal changes, price fluctuations, debtors and transportation costs. Agnes' goals are to establish a big store and have a well-educated family. Agnes needs this loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour

loans.name: Ena Luz

texts.es: Ena Luz S. A.  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde hace 17 años, cuando quedó viuda con sus tres hijos  y decidió buscarles un mejor horizonte, inicialmente trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico durante dos años, época en la cual perfeccionó su forma de preparar comidas,  por eso al dejar esta actividad y unirse a su cónyuge se dedicó a ella; en un principio vendió sopas en porciones y hoy tiene como actividad principal la venta de almuerzos diarios a 35 operarios de la construcción, a la cual ha agregado la venta de deditos de queso, y  de bebidas frías especialmente de cervezas, actividad que realiza los fines de semana en los cuales vende  numero no menor de 30 canastas, también ofrece servicios de telefonía celular, actividades que le representa ingresos adicionales; en su negocio la apoya su nuera, a quien paga diariamente y sostiene un empleo directo. Ena Luz ahora madre de 5 hijos  en las edades de 6 a 21 años, tres de ellos viviendo en otra población con sus abuelos, sigue  soñando con que todos logren ser exitosos y puedan estudiar y ser profesionales de bien; así mismo Ena dirige todos sus esfuerzos para que esto ocurra mediante el arduo trabajo diario y apoyada por su cónyuge que trabaja como celador de una constructora. Este es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará productos no perecederos como arroz, aceite y granos y también cervezas al por mayor,  inversión que augura sea exitosa, no solo por la experiencia de la microempresaria en estas actividades,  sino también porque se acerca la temporada mas alegre, divertida de la Ciudad: El carnaval de Barranquilla donde “todo lo que se ofrece se vende” especialmente los productos que prepara Ena para verbenas y fiesta autóctonas que realizan las familias en sus comunidades.
texts.en:
Ena Luz S. A. arrived in the city of Barranquilla 17 years ago  She had become a widow with three children and decided to seek a better life.  Initially she worked as a domestic worker for two years, during which time she perfected her way of preparing meals.  She therefore stopped this activity and joined with her current spouse who was devoted to her.  At first she sold servings of soup, and today's main activity is the sale of lunches on a daily basis to 35 construction workers.  She has added to this the sale of cheese fingers and cold drinks, especially beer, on the weekends, when she sells at least 30 cases.  She also offers cell phone services, an activity that provides additional income.  Her daughter supports her in this business, she is paid daily and is directly employed by the business.

Ena Luz is now the mother of 5 children aged between 6 to 21 years.  Three of them live in another town with their grandparents.  She dreams of them all achieving success and being able to study and become professionals.  Ena therefore directs all her efforts to make this happen through daily hard work, and she is supported in this by her husband who works as a janitor at a construction firm. 

This is the first funding she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy non-perishable products such as rice, oil, grain and beer at wholesale.  This is an investment that promises to be successful, not only because of the experience of the entrepreneur in these activities but also because the season is about to become more cheerful with fun in the city from The Carnival of Barranquilla, where "everything is for sale", especially those products Ena prepares for festivals and for the local celebrations that take place with families in their communities.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable products such as rice, oil, grains and also beer at wholesale

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosita del Carmen se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más 10 años con este negocio. Sus dos hijos están a su cargo, inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos necesarios. Ella siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de actividad, siempre ha sido responsable y goza de comunicarse con sus clientes que disfrutan de los diferentes platillos que elabora. Este crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, plátanos, maduro, azúcar, platos desechables, vasos y verduras.
texts.en: Rosita del Carmen's business is selling meals.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years and has two children in her care.  She started out in her business in order to cover her expenses.  Rosita has always been a determined person and she enjoys her business.  She has always been responsible and likes communicating with her customers who enjoy the different dishes that she prepares.  She will use this loan to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, bananas, plantain, sugar, disposable plates, glasses and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, bananas, plantain, sugar, disposable plates, glasses and vegetables

loans.name: Olga Visitación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Olga; La socia tiene 70 años D. edad; La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos todos ellos son independientes;  La socia  es una mujer trabajadora y llena D. felicidad, la socia se dedica a administrar y trabajar en su farmacia; la socia tiene una farmacia y desea comprar medicamentos base, para lo cual la socia desea invertir el crédito, la socia trabaja con sus hijos y todo lo que ingresa es para reinvertirse en la compra D. medicamentos, La socia cuenta con proveedores a los cuales ella debe cancelar las cuantas que le dejan, La socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. medicamentos para abastecer su farmacia.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Olga is 70 years old, married, and has 2 children who both live independently.  She is a hard-working woman who is full of happiness.  Olga owns a pharmacy which she manages and works in.
