La socia es la Sra: Anita;  La socia tiene 33 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 1 año de edad; La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella trabaja realizando trabajos en arcilla y otras artesanías la socia las compra, ella se dedica la compra y venta de mercadería y también elaboración de la misma, la socia tiene su pequeño stand en el poblado de Ollantaytambo. La socia desea el cerdito para comprar mercadería y para comprar arcillas y óxidos naturales para los diseños de la cerámica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materiales.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Anita is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 16 and 1.  She is in the handicrafts business.  She makes products from clay and also buys other handicrafts.  She buys and sells merchandise and also makes her own products.  Anita has a small stand in the town of Ollantaytambo.  She would like this loan to buy merchandise with.  She will also buy clay and natural oxides for making designs on her pottery.

Anita is requesting this loan to buy merchandise and materials.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALEGRIA” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, la que tiene como presidenta la señora Julia.   

La señora Julia, indica que es el primer ciclo de trabajo de la A.C. “Alegría”, y que ahora piensa ampliar su mercadería de venta de quesos; los que son vendidos de forma ambulante en las ciudades de La Paz (calles Rodríguez, Gran Poder) y El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es casada y aporta económicamente a su hogar.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó que le dieran la oportunidad de recibir  crédito con la garantía solidaria y el trato de la asesora, pues ella anima a seguir adelante.

Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: Venta de queso, venta de carne, tejido de manta, artesanía, venta de verduras, venta de pescado, venta de quinua.

En la reunión, que tuvimos la oportunidad de visitar, se encontraba una amistad fraterna de parte de las socias, sin embargo no pudimos contar, en la foto, con la presencia de Yola, ya que por razones personales se tuvo que retirar rápidamente.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Alegria” (Joy) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  This group consists of ten members and is led by a Board of Directors.  Sra. Julia serves as its president.  

Sra. Julia says that she is receiving her first loan with the “Alegria” Communal Association.  Now she plans to increase her inventory of cheeses that she sells as a street vendor in the cities of La Paz (along the streets of Rodríguez and Gran Poder) and El Alto.  This type of work enables her to support her family.  Julia is married and contributes financially to her household.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sra. Julia said she enjoys being given the opportunity to access credit with a solidarity guarantee as well as the treatment she receives from her loan officer who encourages her to move forward.  

The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses.  These include selling cheese, selling meat, weaving blankets, making crafts, selling vegetables, selling fish, and selling quinoa.    

Upon visiting this group at their meeting, one could sense the strong friendship that exists among the members.  One member named Yola is not in the photo because she had to leave abruptly for personal reasons.

loans.use: To purchase cheese.

loans.name: Dilcia

texts.es:
la señora Dilcia P. A. tiene 47 años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su pareja le ayuda economicamente (trabaja para la empresa nacional portuaria) Dilcia tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años en donde vende ropa inerior, shampoo, abarroteria, sandalias, zapatos.  su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos varios y asi surtir mas su negocio.
 
en lo particular doña Dilcia es una persona seria de pocas palabras y poca paciencia, tiene su casa propia.
su nivel de vida es bueno, tiene lo necesario y su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Dilcia P. A. is 47 years old and has one dependent child. Her partner helps out financially through his job working for the National Port Authority. For the past four years, Dilcia has managed a store where she sells undergarments, shampoo, groceries, sandals, and shoes. Her business is open Monday through Sunday. This loan will be used to buy various products to increase the inventory of her business.

Doña Dilcia is a serious person of few words who has little patience. She owns her home. Dilcia experiences a good standard of living and has what she needs. Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase various products for her business.

loans.name: Eudoro

texts.es:
Eudoro de 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian su primaria, el Sr. T. labora desde hace 4 años para SERVIPRO donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad en financiera FAMA, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para el sustento de su familia, este Señor es responsable, honesto y de buen vivir segun referncias.   

Solicita su primer crèdito con el apoyo de Kiva para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion con los que pretende poner el piso a su casa de habitaciòn y de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  

Su deseo es cubrir las nesecidades de su familia y que estos vivan comodamente y estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Eudoro, age 38, has two young children who are elementary school students. He has worked for SERVIPRO for four years and is assigned as a security guard for FAMA Financial. Eudoro earns a monthly income to support his family. He is responsible, honest, and conducts himself well according to his references.

Eudoro is requesting his first Kiva loan so that he can invest in the purchase of construction materials. He intends to install a floor in his home so that his family will be more comfortable.

His wish is to cover the family expenses so that they can live comfortably and be right with God.

loans.use: To install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte. Es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. El cliente es muy reconocido por el trabajo que realiza, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado obtener su medio de vida. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, repuestos nuevos, tapizar asientos entre otras cosas para su bus.  Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar. Desea obtener otro medio de ingreso como es su bus.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista provides transportation services. He is a responsible person who enjoys his business, so this is not the first time he has applied for loans. Juan is well-known for the work he does, but he has not accumulated sufficient capital over time to secure his way of life.

This loan will be used to buy tires, new parts, upholstered seats, and other items for his bus so that he can generate household income. Juan wants to obtain another source of income similar to his bus.

loans.use: To purchase tires, new parts, upholstered seats, and other items for his bus.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Lucila;  La socia tiene 80 años de edad; La socia es viuda; y tiene 5 hijos todos independientes; La socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella tiene sus terrenos de maíz y papa, la socia cuanta con el apoyo económico y moral de sus hijos, ella es una socia antigua y le gusta tener su dinero propio e invertir, ella desea el monto para poder invertir en la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizante, del tractoreo de sus terrenos, para lo cual está destinando el monto requerido, la socia, trabaj dentro de este banco más de 5 años y es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy sociable, uno de los motivos por los cuales ella se encuentra dentro de este grupo ameno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y otros para los terrenos de cultivo.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” which is located in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 80 years old, widowed, and has five children, all of whom are independent. Lucila’s main business activity is farming. She has land on which she grows corn and potatoes. Lucila has the financial and moral support of her children. She is a long-time member and enjoys having her own money to invest. Lucila wants to invest the amount of her loan in the purchase of seeds, compost, and fertilizers to use in plowing her land. She has worked with the Communal Bank for more than five years and is a hardworking and sociable woman. One of the reasons why she joined is because she enjoys being part of a group. Lucila is requesting this loan so that she can purchase seeds, compost, and other supplies for her farmland.

Lucila is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost, and other supplies for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa de 25 años, es una joven emprendedora que comenzó desde muy joven a ser comerciante informal.  Con la motivación de la hermana que tenía el mismo negocio ella decidió ser comerciante informal. 

En la actualidad vende artículos y productos de uso personal en su negocio ambulante. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el comprando con el préstamo mercadería como accesorios de teléfono. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 25, is a young entrepreneur who started working as an informal merchant at an early age. Her sister has a similar business and provided her with encouragement, so Rosa decided to become an informal merchant as well.

She currently sells personal use goods and products from a street stall. Rosa works every day from 8am to 9pm. She has many aspirations for her business. For this reason, Rosa wants to continue by using this loan to buy merchandise such as phone accessories. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Romania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Romania;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 3 hijos de 28,25,20 años de edad, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en el poblado de Ollantaytambo, ella desea implementar su negocio y quiere comprar cervezas, ella dice que la venta de cervezas es la que le rinde más por eso desea invertir el crédito en la compra y venta de cervezas, el restaurante que la socia tiene, ella dice que dedica la venta de cervezas por las tardes y hasta las 10 de la noche, no vende más allá de 3 botellas chicas. La socia desea invertir en la compra y venta de cervezas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Romania is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” which is located in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 28, 25, and 20). Romania has a small restaurant in the village of Ollantaytambo. She wants to keep her business in operation and buy beer. Romania says that selling beer generates more revenue, so she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of these beverages for her restaurant. She says she starts selling beer in the afternoons until 10pm and has a three bottle limit per customer. Romania wants to invest in more beer, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Romania is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase beer to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Dulia;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad; La socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y el menor de 1 año y 7 meses; La socia tiene un terreno de cultivo de maíz, ella también se dedica a la administración de su pequeño bar, la socia cultiva maíz, papa, pasto según la época; La socia puso de nombre a su bar “Los Apus”; La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de semillas, abono, preparado de terreno, ella desea el préstamo para invertir en la siembra de una nueva producción de maíz y pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y cuanto se requiera para la siembra de maíz y pasto.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Dulia is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” which is located in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. The older child is 10 years old and the younger one is 1 year and 7 months old. Dulia has farmland on which she grows corn and also manages a small bar. She grows corn, potatoes, and fodder according to the season. Delia named her bar “Los Apus”. She will invest this loan in the purchase of seeds and compost in order to prepare her land. With this new investment, she will be able to grow a new crop of corn and fodder. Therefore, the money she is requesting will be used to buy seeds and compost.

Dulia is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and fodder.

loans.name: .ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ernestina;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad; La socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia  produce y compra diferentes trabajos, ella vende artesanía en la estación de Ollantaytambo la misma que se dirige a la ciudadela inka de Machupicchu, la socia tiene llaveros, mantillas, chullos, adornos, ceniceros, entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (The Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Ernestina is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes and buys different items.  She sells her handicrafts in Ollantaytambo Station which leads to the Incan citadel of Machupicchu.  Ernestina sells keychains, mantillas (lace scarves), 'chullos' (woollen caps with earflaps), decorations, ashtrays and other items.

Ernestina is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Doris;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad; La socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 19,17,3 años de edad;  La socia  tiene un hospedaje en su propia casa, ella acomodo sus habitaciones y los baños para recibir turistas; La socia está en continuos cambios , ampliaciones, acabados, decorados y mucho más en lo referente a su vivienda, ella siempre que tiene un dinero extra lo invierte en mejorar sus ambientes, ella en esta oportunidad está deseando el crédito para ampliar y mejorar sus ambientes dentro del hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la  ampliación de ambientes dentro del hospedaje.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (The Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Doris is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 3.  She provides accommodations in her own home where she has adapted rooms and bathrooms to receive tourists. She is constantly making changes, extensions, finishing off building work, decorating and doing other work related to her property.  Every time she has a bit of extra money she invests it in improving the rooms within her guest house. 

Doris is requesting this loan to invest in extending the rooms within her guest house.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in extending rooms within her guest house

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Francisca;  La socia tiene 53 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos son independientes y dos de ellos de 33 y 28 años aún reciben apoyo en sus estudios, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el mercado artesanal, ubicado en la estación de Ollantaytambo, llamado Sr De Choquequillca, la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (The Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Francisca is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom live independently and two of whom are aged 33 and 28 and still receiving her support in their studies.  Francisca runs a grocery store in the craft market which is located in Ollantaytambo Station.  It is called 'Sr De Chquequillca'.

Francisca would like this loan so that she can invest in buying merchandise to stock her business.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Marmol

texts.es:
Marmol de 64 años, es un hombre trabajador que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido tener su negocio ambulante de atciculos y productos de uso personal. 

Comenzó a vender productos de uso personal en las calles, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener una economía estable, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Para seguir trabajando con la venta de productos necesita comprar con el préstamo pasta de dientes, papel higiénico etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
64 year-old Marmol is a hard-working man who, through a lot of hard work and commitment, has been able to set up his own business selling personal care products as an itinerant street trader.

Marmol started selling personal care products in the streets.  With effort, he gradually managed to become financially stable.  He works from 6.00am to 7.00pm every day.  In order to continue selling his products, he needs to use his loan to buy toothpaste, toilet paper, etc.  In the future, he would like to finish building his home and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, accessories and articles

loans.name: Sofia Karem

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sofia;  La socia tiene 26 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 1 hijo de 3 años; la socia tiene un restaurante en el cual ella misma elabora diferentes platos, la socia cocina, la socia suele comprar insumos al por mayor, ella compra fideos, azúcar, arroz, aceite todos los productos al por mayor para que le pueda salir a costo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO” [The Friendship of Ollantaytambo] community bank. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, province of Urubamba, departament of Cuzco.

The member is named Sofia. She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage and she has one 3 year old son. The member has a restaurant where she makes different dishes. She usually buys her ingredients wholesale. She buys noodles, sugar, rice, oil- all products wholesale so she can get them at cost. Sofia is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients wholesale.     

Sofia is satisfied with the loan and committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan tiene 67 años, es casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años. Viven en la parte urbana del distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace más de 20 años, se dedica a la venta de bolsas. Vende sus productos diariamente en un puesto en el mercado local de Chepén. Juan es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Juan es muy trabajador y responsable. Tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 67 years old, married, and has a 15 year-old son.  They live in the urban part of Chepén district, in La Libertad region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 20 years, Juan has been selling bags.  He sells his products daily from a stall in Chepén local market.  Juan is very well known in his area and has an established customer base.  He would like to expand his business by purchasing more merchandise to sell.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Juan is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He has good work references and personal references from his community.  His greatest wish is to continue working to get his family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more bags

loans.name: Saihantuya

texts.en:
Saihantuya, 44, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, her older son attends a local secondary school and her younger daughter goes to kindergarten.

Saihantuya began operating a bakery business in 1998 and started selling clothing in 2000. She imports consumer goods from Erlian, a Chinese border city, and sells them at her rented stall. She wants to expand her business and increase her variety of goods. Saihantuya is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to carry on this business and make more profit in order to be able to afford my children's school fees." She is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to import more consumer goods from China.

loans.use: to import more consumer goods

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Nandintsetseg, 23, is married and lives with her husband and a 3-year-old son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Nandintsetseg's husband works as a welder and gets paid 300,000 MNT monthly.

Nandintsetseg began operating a clothing sales business in 2007 after she graduated from high school in 2006. In addition to her clothing business, she participates in every kind of social activity. Nandintsetseg rents a stall at a local market and she wants to enlarge it by expanding her business. She is a hardworking person who says, "I would like to have my own container which I can operate as a clothing store in the future." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell in his store

loans.name: Ochirjantsan

texts.en:
Ochirjantsan, 45, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living. Ochirjantsan's wife helps him with the business and his two older children attend a local secondary school.

Ochirjantsan used to work as a carpenter for a small wood production factory until 1998, when he began operating his own carpentry business. He currently operates his business at home and is building a workshop which he wants to finish by the summer. He is a hardworking person who says, "First of all, I want to finish my workshop building and save money to build a house in the future." He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Viven en la ciudad de Picsi, una comunidad urbana y emergente con grandes proyecciones de desarrollo.

Gana su vida brindando servicios como Técnico Laboratorista en Essalud, un hospital público del Estado. Lleva cinco años dedicándose a este oficio, y un año trabajando con la institución de Essalud. Con los ingresos de su trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en el costo de un curso de especialización en el cual desea inscribirse para facilitar y mejorar su desempeño laboral. También, desea usar una parte de su crédito para comprar útiles escolares para su hijo menor. Percy es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha manejado otro préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones en manera puntual.
texts.en:
Percy is 34 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives in the town of Picsi which is an emerging urban community that has great scope for development.

Percy earns his living providing services as a laboratory technician.  He works for Essalud in a public, state-run hospital.  He has been in this line of work for five years and has been working for Essalud for one year.  He uses the income from his work to cover his family expenses.

Percy has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the cost of a specialization course which he wants to enrol in, in order to improve his work performance.  He would also like to use some of his loan money to buy school supplies for his young son.

Percy is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He has received a previous loan from Edpyme Alternativa and made his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to enrol in a specialization course and to buy school supplies for his son

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 53 años D. edad, es soltera, y tiene hijos ya independientes. Vive en San Pedro, un caserío mediano en TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace ocho años, se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores y aves D. corral. Cría los animales en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. 

Desea invertir su crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles en la compra D. más animales como pavos pequeños y gallinas ponedoras. Con esta inversión, espera ampliar su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para hacer arreglos a su casa y solventar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old, single, and her children already live independently.  Mercedes lives in San Pedro, a medium-sized village in TambogranD..  This is an agricultural area located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

For the past eight years, Mercedes has been raising and selling young animals and poultry.  She raises the animals in an area behind her home and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who visit her area.

Mercedes would like to invest her loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles in buying more animals such as turkeys and laying hens.  With this investment, she hopes to expand her business and thereby make acceptable profits that will allow her to make some repairs to her home and cover her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise

loans.name: Eradio

texts.es:
Eradio tiene 66 años de edad, es soltero y tiene hijos ya independientes. Vive en casa propia y humilde de adobe de un piso en el distrito de La Victoria, unos treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 20 años, cuenta con una panadería en su propio domicilio donde tiene un horno artesanal. Eradio vende sus alimentos diariamente y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir parte de su crédito de 800 nuevos soles en unos arreglos a su horno y en la compra de insumos que ayudará aumentar la producción de su pan. También desea usar una parte para solventar gastos escolares para sus nietos. Eradio es muy trabajador y responsable. Tiene buenas ideas para continuar a crecer su negocio y les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Eradio is 66 years old, single, and has children who are already grown up.  He lives in his own home which is a modest, one-storey, adobe house located in La Victoria district, thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 20 years, Eradio has had a bakery in his home where he has an artisanal oven.  Eradio sells his products daily and has an established customer base.  He would like to invest part of his loan for 800 Peruvian soles in making some repairs to his oven and in buying supplies that will help him to increase his bread production.  He would also like to use part of his loan money to cover his grandchildren's school expenses.

Eradio is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He has good ideas of how to continue growing his business and he is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in helping him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fix his oven

loans.name: Adelisa

texts.en:
Adelisa is a married woman who lives in  Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, a carenderia (local eatery) and a tricycle transport business. Her husband Carlito, who is 52 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 22 and 28 years old. 

Adelisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future enlargement of her business. Adelisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Santos Simona

texts.es:
Santos tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos menores. Vive en Vallecito, un caserío en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace dos años, se dedica a la venta de comida y la producción de chicha de jora, una bebida típica de Perú a base de harina y maíz. Realiza estas actividades en su propio domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de otra olla y más animales.  La inversión la ayudará a reducir el tiempo de preparación de la chicha y tener más tiempo para estar con su familia. También, espera aumentar su producción y venta de chicha para lograr mejores utilidades que puedan utilizar para seguir cuidando de sus niños. Santos es muy trabajadora y responsable. Ya ha manejado un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Santos is 36 years old, single, and has 3 dependent children.  She lives in Vallecito, a small village in Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

For two years, Santos has been selling meals and making 'chicha de jora' (a traditional Peruvian, flour- and corn-based drink).  She carries out these business activities in her own home.  Santos has requested a loan for 600 Peruvian soles to invest in buying a new pot and more animals.  This investment will help her to reduce the amount of time it takes her to make her 'chicha' and free up more time for her to spend with her family.  She also hopes to increase her 'chicha' production and sales in order to make better profits that she can use to continue taking care of her children.

Santos is a very hard-working and responsible woman.  She has managed a previous loan from Edpyme Alternativa and made her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a pot and more animals

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in an apartment that they have owned since 2005 and have a decent standard of living. Oyunchimeg's husband works for a mining company and has a part time job, earning monthly salaries of 300,000 MNT and 250,000 MNT respectively.

Oyunchimeg began operating a clothing sales business in 2006. She rents a stall at a local trading center and sells consumer goods such as hats and sunglasses, which she imports from China. She wants to expand her business and increase her profit in the future. Oyunchimeg is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I am trying to expand my business and save money for my children's future studies." She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to import more consumer goods from China.

loans.use: to import more consumer goods

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum L., age 47, is a fish seller in the busy market in Kompong Tom province. For many years she has been selling fish that she gets from her husband or buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen.  She is married to Vain Sophally, age 48, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. Soum L. always uses her old motorbike to pick up the fish to sell. Unfortunately, her existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Soum L. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to fix the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To fix her broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Tsendmaa

texts.en:
Tsendmaa, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past five years. Tsendmaa's husband operates a transportation service and earns 250,000 MNT monthly from his business. Her older daughter attends a local high school and her youngest son goes to kindergarten.

Tsendmaa began operating a business making clothing in 2006. She decided to operate her own workshop as people are getting more and more interested in wearing traditional clothes such as deels, Mongolian traditional coats, vests, and traditional dresses for every kind of special occasion. Tsendmaa gets more custom orders during the holidays. Her current working capital is 1,200,000 MNT. She wants to further expand her business and have her own workshop in the future. Tsendmaa is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want my children to have a good education. By making more profit, I would like to restore our house and have my own workshop." She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more textiles and cloth for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more textiles and cloth

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman who lives in Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her common-law husband Adolfo, who is 46 years old, works as a chainsaw operator to earn his living.  They have five children who are between 1 and 17 years old. 

Juanita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juanita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more products to resell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and the education of her children. Juanita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a married woman who lives in Badian, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her husband Romeo, who is 44 years old, works as a municipal driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are 7 and 15 years old. Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Belinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Tom, Eng R., 55, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$2 per day and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 40 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. Eng R. is the mother of three teenage children, all of whom are in school. Eng R. is concerned that she is hardly riding her bicycle to sell and she dreams of having a used motorbike to pick up her fish, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Eng R. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman who lives in Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling ginger/bamboo shoots and rice. Her husband Rodrigo, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 7 and 32 years old. 

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more ginger and bamboo shoots to sell in the market so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and household improvements. Norma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more ginger and bamboo shoots to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Pen T., age 38, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Since 2000, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with six children, two of whom are single and the rest are married and live in their own house. Her husband earns a living by providing band services to his neighbors and other villagers in and around his community. Mrs. Pen T. is going to use her loan to add to her current savings to buy a piece of farm land near her house. She will use this land for her farming business or to rent out to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a piece of farm land

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Bich T. N. is 33 years old.  She lives with her 3 children in Kinh No village. She operates a small grocery shop from her house, selling many kinds of products  such as wine, rice, beer, etc.   Her business has developed well since she received a loan from our credit program in 2005.   Bich earns 100,000 VND daily in profit from this shop, which helps her cover family expenditures. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Van T. N. is 35 years old and has 2 children. She raises ducks for eggs. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy feed.

Ha T. B.  is 45 years old and has 2 children. She grows fruits trees and raises chickens for meat. She needs a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy feed and fertilizer.

Thinh T. N. is 47 years old. She raises chickens and ducks for meat. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to  invest in her shop

loans.name: Keal

texts.en:
Keal P., 56-year-old married mother of two children, each employed in a different job, has made rattan cupboards at home since 2006. Her husband is a bed seller in Kompong Tom Province. Both of them also order rattan and beds in bulk from braiders and furniture makers, retailing them door-to-door across the province. They usually sell all of their products within a week or two.

Because their items are reasonably priced, the couple's businesses are doing very well, and in order to better satisfy their customers' needs, Keal P. seeks a loan to stock a larger number of beds to sell.

loans.use: to stock a bigger amount of beds to sell.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket K. H. has spent her whole life cultivating crops in the province of Kompong Cham. She is now married and has four school-aged children. Her husband works alongside his wife in the fields. She and her husband always grow their crops on an annual schedule, a system with which they have experienced great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year, according to the rainy and dry seasons. 

Ket K. is taking out this loan in order to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming. She plans to grow a variety of crops on her new land.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van K. H., age 28, owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow and harvest a variety of crops. She and her husband (both pictured here) are villagers living in a medium-sized house with their two children in Kompong Cham province.

Van K. H.'s family is experiencing significant discomforts at present because the house is old and in constant need of repairs. She is requesting a loan in order to buy planks to make essential repairs to the home.

loans.use: to buy planks in order to make essential repairs to the family home

loans.name: Bibian's Group

texts.en:
Bibian A. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Bibian is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bibian is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP monthly from these activities.

In 2010, Bibian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Bibian is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa J. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Felisa is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Felisa plants and harvests sugar cane for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Felisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used for farm maintenance labor and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan is her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her sugar cane farm

loans.name: Andrelly

texts.en:
Andrelly is a married woman from the town of San Francisco. She has 3 children, aged 10, 4 and 3. Her oldest child is the only one in school right now. 

Andrelly works hard to earn and save for her children's education. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their land to plant and harvest rice crops. Andrelly has applied for a loan of 4000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Andrelly wishes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy T., age 47 and a widow, is a farmer. She grows a variety of crops on her farmland, which she inherited from her grandmother. She has three children, one of whom is grown and working as a repairman in the local car station.

Suy T. recently bought a plot of farmland from her neighbor to supplement her existing land, but she paid only half of the total cost of the land and the rest is on credit. She would like to take out a loan in order to pay for the remainder of her newly purchased land and begin to make full use of this additional asset to her farming business.

loans.use: to help her buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara A. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 60 years old. Genara is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Genara owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Genara has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Genara joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genara has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise. This loan will be her third loan from GDMPC. Genara plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old. Her husband’s name is M. and he has a power loom business. He operates his business from his home and it is going well for him. Because of his experience of 18 years in his business, he receives a good number of orders every month and they earn him regular income. Shahnaz also helps her husband in his business, when M. goes out of home to collect orders. Shahnaz operates his power loom machine for preparing bed sheets.

She is also a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. She has enrolled them into school and they are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread to prepare larger quantity of bed sheets which will help him to complete larger orders on-time and to earn better profits. Shahnaz is very confident that the loan investment will help him earn better profits and she will be able to live a better standard of living with her family as a result.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her s econdloan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time.

She lives in Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Bhutta sohan din.

loans.use: To buy thread for bed sheets-making business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, 43, lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old while the youngest is only 4.

Estrella is a rice farmer and has been selling rice for quite some time now. Her husband is also a farmer. Estrella says they work hard to keep their farm productive. Estrella also requested for a loan of 6,000 PHP to fund their farm. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

Helen, 43, is a married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco. She has five children, the oldest of whom is 23 years old.

Helen is a farmer and primarily plants rice crops. She sells her harvest to the market where she has more access to customers. She needs a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Helen hopes to see her children be successful.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has lived with her family in the area of Bhutta sohan din in a 3-room brick house for the past 10 years. 

Khalida is 35 years old and has 4 daughters. Her 2 elder daughters are enrolled in a school and getting their education, while her younger daughters are not yet of school age.  Her husband operates a power loom machine and prepares bedsheets. His bedsheets are in high demand because he is very good at his work and produces quality work with good designs. 

Khalida also supports her husband by making bedsheets. She is very skillful and helps her husband in fulfilling larger orders on time. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread in larger quantitues to make more bedsheets to sell and to earn better profits. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will bring her husband’s business to a better position and he will be able to make more money than before.

loans.use: to buy thread for bedsheet making business

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem lives in Kasur, a small city of Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives in the area of Bhutta sohan din with her family in a single-room brick house.

She is 38 years old and has 5 children. Her 2 elder sons work while the others are enrolled in school and getting their education. Tasleem couldn’t provide an education to her elder children due to financial constraints but she wants her younger children to complete their education and become successful in their lives.

Her husband’s name is M. A. and he works in a thread-making business. He is illiterate and made this business to earn money for his family. Tasleem is very supportive in nature.  In addition to her household work, she also supports her husband in making thread. They get thread from the old warm clothes such as sweaters and sell them to the thread sellers of the market for a profit.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy sweaters in larger quantity to get thread and to fulfill larger orders on time. Her husband has good business contacts and is hopeful that an investment will be productive for his business growth.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. T. N. is 35 years old and has two children who are in secondary school. She has been a farmer for many years. Her main activity focuses on growing flowers and clean vegetables. Everyday, she takes them to the center market to sell wholesale. In this way, she can have a stable income from this activity. 

Joining with our credit program in 2004, she has received seven loans year after year and used them very effectively in running her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more fertilizer and some equipment to increase her product quality.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and some equipment

loans.name: Sagheer

texts.en:
Sagheer is 42 years old and has given birth to four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  She does embroidery and stitching work at her home. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and completes the orders to earn an income for her family.  She belongs to Kasur, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, which is famous for its leather industry. She has lived there for the past eighteen years in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Bhutta sohan din.

Her husband’s name is Y. and he has two businesses. He supplies construction material to different construction companies on order. In addition, he sells animals to butchers after raising them up.
 
Sagheer has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to further expand her husband’s construction supplies business. With the loan, he will buy cement, sand and bricks in larger quantities to be able to fulfill larger orders and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past fourteen years, and Sagheer is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and paid installments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks for resale

loans.name: Nha's Group

texts.en:

She sells many  kinds of products, such as wine, rice, beer, etc. Her business has had strong development since she got her first loan from our credit program in 2005.  Everyday, she gets close to $5 profit from this shop and it helps her cover her family's expenditures. She is also growing flowers to sell and raising four pigs for meat.  Currently, she wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the flowers and food for the pigs.

At T. N. is 35 years old with two children. She raises chickens for their eggs. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Mien T. D. is 33 years old with 2 children. She is growing fruit trees and raising chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy chicken food and fertilizer for the trees.

Ha V. T. N. is 33 years old with 2 children. She has a shop that sells electrical equipment. She wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to buy flower fertilizer and pig food.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam belongs to a small city in Pakistan called Kasur which is famous for its tanneries industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Paka qila for the past ten years. She is a very supportive lady by nature. In order to help her husband financially support the family, she stitches clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. Mariam is the mother of four daughters and two sons. Her sons are involved in the business of recycling scrap while her daughters are getting their education.
 
Her husband’s name is J. and he is involved in a swings business. He particularly offers his swings services to young children. Children enjoy a lot of his swings and they are in high demand in his area. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another swing called a "revolving whirl". This will help him to entertain more children and earn better profits.  He has been operating this business for the past ten years and Mariam is hopeful that an investment will improve the financial condition of his business. 

Mariam is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Mariam.

loans.use: to buy a swing called a "revolving whirl".

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a furniture shop, a general store and a cafeteria. Her husband Egmedio, who is 68 years old, works as a welder to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 29 and 39 years old. 

Elsa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy materials for her furniture-making business. Elsa is working hard so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of the business. Elsa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase  materials to make furniture
