loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. T.  is 39 years old with two children who are in high school. She has a shop in a local market that sells aquatic products such as fish, snails, and crabs. Her business has been running for 3 years, ever since she first received loans in 2007. It  creates considerabL. income for her to use to support her family. 

Regarding to her participatory attitude to our credit program, she has a good repayment record and has invested effectively in expanding her business.  In this new loan cycL., she wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

Mien T. N. is 46 years old with two children. Her earning activities are growing rice and raising pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy feed for  the pigs.

Nu T. L. is 47 years old with two children. She is running a small restaurant in her village. She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy more tables and desks.

 Bich  N.  T. N. is  42 years old with three children . She grows rice, corn, and tomatoes in  paddies of 4,700 square meters. She wants to  have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy   fertilizer.

 Tuan T. N. is 45 years old with three children . She has run a grocery shop for 4 years. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

 Hao T. N. is 48 years. She lives with  her family in Laida village.  Running a fashion shop  for five years, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy  more  new styles of trousers and shirts.

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S. Y., age 38, is a rice farmer who lives in the Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham provice. 

He earns about $3.25 per day for his farming business. He has a plot of farmland that came from his grandparent. Kuy S. Y. uses this farmland for growing rice crops as an annual activity, following the rainy season and the dry season. 

He was married but he divorced his wife years ago, and now he lives with his two single kids, who still study in school. 

Besides growing crops, Kuy S. Y. has always been successful in his pig-raising investment because he learned the formula to this sector years ago. To earn additional income, Kuy S. Y. is applying for a loan to buy pig feed and piglets to breed.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets to breed

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien T. N., 24 years old with one child is living in Phuc Hau village.  She is a wood caver for a wood workshop near her house. Every month, she can get a salary of 2,000,000 VND. This amount of money is not enough for her to cover daily expenses so she raises 200 chickens for eggs. Borrowing money from our credit program in the past, she has bought feed for them. This cycle, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to upgrade her hen-house.

 Loan T. N. is 45 years old with three children. She is raising 300 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy   feed for them.

 Dich T. P. is 43 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

 Vuong T. C. is 30 years old with one child. She is raising   300 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy feed for them.

 Thanh T. H. is 46 years old. She sells rice sticks as breakfast. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy rice-stick making materials.

loans.use: to upgrade her hen-house.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr: Esperance M. a un restaurant, et elle est client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née au Burundi, et elle a 7 enfants entre 8 ans et 22 ans, et une personne en charge.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et Esperance a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire (au niveau A2).  Ce prêt est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’un frigo, 2 douzaines d’assiettes, 4 chauffes, et 30 gobelets pour son business de restaurant.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer la capacité de l’affaire, en augmentant la quantité, ainsi que la qualité de son business.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande femme d’affaire, et bâtir sa propre maison commerciale.  Elle veut aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Esperance M. has a restaurant and is a member of ACB since 2010. Born in Burundi, she is married with seven children ranging in age from 8 to 22 years old. She also has another person in her care. Esperance completed six years of secondary school (A2 level) and all her children attend school. 

This is her first loan cycle with ACB, and she plans to use the credit to buy a refrigerator, two dozen plates, four hot plates, and thirty cups for her restaurant. Her business growth strategy is to bolster her activity by improving both in volume and quality. 

She wishes to become a great businesswoman, and build her own commercial property. She also wants to ensure her family’s well-being and pay for her children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, two dozen plates, four hot plates and thirty cups for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to use for cultivating land.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savons, de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des savons, des bois de chauffe et des  sacs de charbon de bois.                                                                         
SITAN D. compte acheter des condiments au marché de Fana auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement, à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djantoyerela are all married and average 42 years of age and four children all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, subprefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments, soaps, firewood, and charcoal.

The women of the group Djantoyerela are on their 16th solidarity loan, which will be used for buying condiments, soaps, firewood, and sacks of charcoal.

Ms. SITAN D. plans on buying some condiments at the Fana market from local wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales each day at the house and at the Fana market. Her customer base is composed essentially of women

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to cover the cost of helping with societal events. The rest of it will be reinvested in her business selling condiments.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city, known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Medina town for the past 18 years. She is 39 years old, married to N. M., and has two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  

Her husband works in a private company. His income is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family that’s why, a few years ago, Rehana started sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She learnt this art from her mother and has become an expert after considerable practice.  She is a very responsible person. As a mother she is also taking care of her family very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she  will buy a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes a lot of time to sew a single dress. The new machine will help her complete orders on time and make more profit.  She hopes that the investment will bring positive changes to her business and improve her financial position.  She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application through Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 28 years old and is married with two children who are one and three years old. Providence owns a small shop selling a variety of goods such as juice, soap, body lotion, cooking oil, sugar, etc. This is her four successful year in this business.

Providence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase sugar in larger quantity in order to get a better price. With more goods for sale, Providence hopes that her profits will increase and allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo qui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers de boutique, de charbon de bois et de céréales.                                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire et tous les quinze prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                         
M’PENE F. compte acheter des articles divers de boutique avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’articles de boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are all married women, averaging 42 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoor Region (The second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell various everyday needs items as well as charcoal and cereals. The members of the Djekafo group are on their 16th solidarity loan; all 15 prior loans have been well repaid.

M’pene F. plans to purchase every day needs article from vendors at the Fana market. She sells daily out of her home in the village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan, cover the costs of her participation in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase everyday needs items

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 24 years old and is married with two children aged two years and  and six months. He has been doing mixed farming for three years, producing and selling milk, maize and vegetables to the local market.   He earns additional income from his carpentry workshop.

Moses has requested this loan amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow. He says he expects improvement on his milk production and better income for the family which will ensure better meals and clothing for his young family. He is focusing on expanding his farm in future and rearing more dairy cows.

Moses points to increased competition as the major challenge as it results in fluctuating prices. He would be happy if the loan products were diversified further.

loans.use: to purchase and ensure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kekognouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kekognouman qui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des condiments, du riz, du charbon de bois et du beurre de karité.                                                                                                                               
Après avoir correctement remboursés les quinze prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Kekognouman sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.                                                                       
KAFOUNE D. compte acheter des condiments alimentaires avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments alimentaires.
texts.en:
he members of the Kekognouman group are all married women, averaging 38 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments, rice, charcoal and shea butter. After having duly repaid 15 prior loans, the members of the Kekognouman group are on their 16th solidarity loan.

Kafoune D. plans to  purchase food condiments from resellers af thte Fana Market. She sells daily out of her home in the village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan, with the remainder of the income reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase food condiments

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a fifty-five-year-old single mother of four children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility for looking after her children  rests solely on her, and her dream is to build a permanent house. For twenty-two years, she has been farming and she is still reaping high yields. She has challenges with price fluctuation due to seasonal changes and her desire is to farm at least twenty acres of land. Imelda needs the credit facility to grow onions.

loans.use: to prepare land for growing onions.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.fr: Isaie M. est éleveur des poules, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 29 ans, célibataire, et né à Rwanda.  Il a fini un niveau d’éducation d’A1 en gestion.  Ce crédit et son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 192 petits poussins, et 1500kgs du repas de poussins, et autres dépenses relative a son business.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter des petits poussins, chercher et garder le marché de son affaire (par exemple, la vente d’eux dans les restaurants dans la ville de Gisenyi).  Il voudrait devenir un grand éleveur dans le district de Rubavu, préparer et bâtir sa propre maison d’habitation.  Il veut aussi préparer pour son futur en paiement de ses frais d’études.
texts.en: Isaie M.  is a poultry farmer and a client of ACB since 2010. He is 29 years old and single. He was born in Rwanda. He has finished A1 level studies [roughly equivalent to junior college] in management. This loan is his first cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to  pay for 129 chicks, 1500 kg of chicken feed and other expenses necessary to his business. His business strategy is to keep increasing the number of chicks as well as identify and keep his market niche (for example, selling to restaurants in the town of Gisenyi). He wants to become a large-scale farmer in the Rubavu district and have his own house built. He would also like to plan for his future in paying for his studies.

loans.use: to purchase 129 chicks, 1500 kg of chicken feed, and other necessities for his farm

loans.name: Sainte Therese Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE THÉRÈSE est né au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE1 qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont de quartiers différents mais qui se réunissent tous les mois pour les activités du Banc Villageois. Leurs activités sont très diverses: elles font de l'élevage, de l'embouche porcine, du petit commerce etc.

Madame Louise Coumba D. (à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la garde de ses deux petites sœurs et d'un garçon qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Elle fait de l'élevage de porcs depuis environs 05 ans. Elle fait également de l'abattage de porcs. Elle achète des porcs adultes les fait abattre pour vendre la viande au kg. Sa clientèle est constituée de son voisinage immédiat. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter 05 pourceaux qu'elle va élever et 04 porcs adules destinés à l'abattage.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple l'achat de la nourriture, prise en charge de la santé des enfants et la participation à la prise en charge de leur scolarité
texts.en: The Sainte Thérèse solidarity group began on the same day as the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Sainte Anne, which hosts it.  It is made up of 10 women who are from different neighborhoods but who come together each month for the operation of the Banc Villageois.  Their businesses are very diverse: they raise livestock, fatten pigs, run small businesses, etc.  Madame Louise Coumba D. (to the right of the photo) is the leader of the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children, who are in her care.  She also cares for her two little sisters and a boy who is entrusted to her by her close friends.  She has raised pigs for around 5 years.  She slaughters the pigs as well.  She buys adult pigs and slaughters them to sell the meat by the kilogram.  Her customer base is made up of her immediate neighbors.  This new loan will allow her to buy 5 piglets, which she will raise, and 4 adult pigs meant for slaughter.  Her objective is to support her husband in caring for the family.  This includes purchasing food, caring for the health of the children, and participating in paying for their education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 piglets and 4 adult pigs

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments (tels le choux etc), d’articles divers de boutique et des savons.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur sixième prêt et SITAN B. qui un membre du groupe compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana, pour ensuite revendre quotidiennement sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en: The women of the group Laïdou, all married, are 38 years old on average, have 4 children and live in large traditional families in Warassala village, in the Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell condiments (such as cabbage), various boutique items, and soaps.  The women of the Laïdou group are on their sixth loan and Sitan Bagayoga, who is a member of the group, expects to buy spices from the re-sellers at the Fana market, to then re-sell it on a day-to-day basis there in the village, for cash and credit to a customer base made up of men and woman.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back the loan and to contribute to social ceremonies, while the rest will be re-invested in her business of selling spices.

loans.use: to purchase spices for food

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce du charbon de bois et de l’essence.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                     
OUMOU B. compte acheter du riz et des condiments pour la restauration qu’elle effectue au niveau du village de Warassala, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en: The women of the Sabougnouman group, all married, are 41 years old on average, have 3 children and all live in large traditional families in the Warassala village, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell food, charcoal, and gas.  The women of the Sabougnouman group are on their sixth group loan and all their previous loans were paid back in full.  Oumou B. expects to buy rice and spices for her food sales, which she does at the Warassala village level, for cash and credit to a customer base made up of men and women.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA which will be used to make payments on the loan, and the rest will be re-invested in her catering business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for catering

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Jean Pierre S. est un prêtre, éleveur, et agriculteur dans le district du Rubavu, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il est marie, ne a Rwanda, et il a 8 enfants entre 6 ans et 30 ans.  Tous de ses enfants vont a l’école, et Jean Pierre a fini deux ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son 3eme cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de pierres, 10 sacs de ciments, 11 kgs de clous et main d’œuvre pour la construction d’une maison de location.  Il voudrait bâtir beaucoup des grandes, propres maison pour son affaire.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien-être, bâtir d’autres maisons d’habitation, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre S. is a priest, livestock farmer, and grower in the Rubavu district. He has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married, was born in Rwanda, and has eight children, aged 6 to 30. All the children go to school, and Jean Pierre has finished two years of secondary school.

This loan is on its third cycle with ACB, and Jean Pierre has a good record in repaying loans. He is going to use his loan to buy 20 sacks of stones, 10 sacks of cement, 11 kg of nails, and the labor for building a house to rent out. He would like to build many large and proper houses for his business.  As for his family members, he would like to ensure their well-being, to build more homes, and to cover his children's schooling costs.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of stones, 10 sacks of cement, 11 kg of nails, and labor for building a house to rent

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sérieux, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du charbon de bois, d’articles divers et de la farine de blé frite.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Sérieux sont à leur seizième prêt.                                                                         MABILE F., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter des sacs de charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au bord du goudron, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sérieux are all married and average 32 years of age and three children living for the most part in nuclear families in the village of Warassala, subprefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in charcoal, a variety of goods, and fried wheat flour.  

The women of the group Sérieux are on their 16th loan. Ms. MABILE F., who is the group’s president, plans on buying sacks of charcoal from charcoal providers in and around the village. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales each day at the edge of the asphalt. Her customer base comprises women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan payments and to cover her contributions to societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha Y., 48 years old, is a widowed woman who owns a small house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, shampoo and soft drinks. Ha Y. retails her inventory to people who are passing by and who are also her neighbors living near her house. She has been running a grocery investment for a long time and earns an average of $5 a day. She also relies on her son’s business. He normally needs to reserve a section of the pond where small fish grow, and he also catches them to sell when the fish are mature. Recently, he has needed more money to supply his business, so Ha Y. has requested a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To assistst in her son's fish-feeding business.

loans.name: Hemazro  Folly

texts.fr: Monsieur Folly a 24 ans. IL est née à Lomé et habite quartier Bè.  Il exerce comme  activité  l’Info-graphisme.  En  effet   il a commencé cette activité en 2007  et  a son atelier  à côté de la station Bè.  Il s’approvisionne à la société NEACOMPS. Il  demande  un  crédit pour  acheter un ordinateur et de ce fait  satisfaire plusieurs  clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Folly is 24 years old. He was born in Lomé and lives in the district of Bè. 

He works as a computer graphics technician. He started this activity in 2007 and keeps a studio near the Bè station. He buys his supplies from NEACOMPS. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a computer, which will allow him to serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Madame HÉLÈNE T. est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis 04 ans et demi. Elle a 09 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide et de l'élevage de porcs. Elle est très expérimentée dans ces activités pour les avoir menées depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'une part, d'acheter de l'arachide à transformer en huile et d'autre part acheter de pourceaux pour l'élevage

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs Hélène T. is a 40 year-old married mother of five. She has been a member of the Sainte Anne 2 credit association for four and a half years.  She has received 9 consecutive loans and has never failed to repay them. 

She produces peanut oil and rears pigs for a living, and has over 10 years' experience in these fields. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase more peanuts for producing oil, and will also help her to buy more pigs for rearing. 

Her aim is to be able to see to her family's needs, for example their food and her children's education. She would also like to put some money aside for savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and pigs for rearing

loans.name: C5611 Terimbere Group

texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and is a widow with two children, 12 and 15 years old. She is the representative of a group which is called "Terimbere" in the local language. Martha owns a small shop which sells shoes and clothes and she has an experience of five years in her business. She employs one person in her business as a helper so that her business runs well. Martha is the second person in the white shirt on the left side. 

Martha and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cloth, shoes, African-print cloth, etc. With her increased profits, Martha hopes to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eric Opanga

texts.en:
Eric Opanga is a sole proprietor businessman who runs a spare-parts shop in the Kosirai Trading Centre in Kapsabet town. He has been in this business for seven years, and earns an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.  He is 23 years old and married with one child who is 7 months old; he supports three people.  

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution), and he learned about KADET from a member of a group registered with KADET. He is applying for a first loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy more stock of spare parts for sale.          

Eric intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plow back into the business. In the future, he desires to grow his business, buy a plot of land and settle his family.

loans.use: Purchase stock of spare parts

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Madame HÉLÈNE N. est une femme de 61 ans ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 03 petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis le 22 juin 2004. 

Elle fait de l'embouche porcine comme activité principale. Et comme activité secondaire elle vend de la crème glacée et de la glace. Elle pratique l'élevage de porcs depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter 15 pourceaux pour renforcer son élevage de porcs et de payer les factures d'électricité liées à la vente de crème et de glace. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille par l'achat de la nourriture et le payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Hélène N. is a 61-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She also has three of her grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAINTE ANNE2 since June 22, 2004.

Hélène fattens pigs as her main business. And as her secondary business, she sells ice cream and ice. She has been raising pigs for over ten years.

Her loan will enable her to buy 15 hogs for bolstering her livestock business and covering the cost of electricity associated with the selling of ice cream and the ice.

Hélène's goal is to boost her savings and to help support her family by buying food and covering her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy 15 hogs

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr: Clémentine D. est élévatrice du porc dans le district du Rubavu.  Elle est mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 2 ans et 5 ans, un de qui va a l’école, et une personne en charge.  Clémentine a un niveau d’éducation d’A2 en Pédagogie, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des bétails (porc) pour en élever, et construire leur ferme.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de suivre de près la sante de ses bétails, augmenter le nombre des bétails à élever, protéger-les contre les maladies, et les nourrir bien.  Elle voudrait élever le nombre d’élevage, tirer une source de revenu suffisant dans ce projet, et l’autofinancement de ce projet.  Pour sa famille et sa vie, elle voudrait scolariser tous ses enfants, continuer ses études, et améliorer l’habitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Clémentine D. raises pigs in the Rubavu district. She is married and has two children (a two-year-old and a five-year-old; one of them goes to school) and a dependent. Clémentine is educated to the A2 level in pedagogy; this credit is her first cycle with ABC. She will use her loan to purchase livestock (pigs), to raise it, and to build up her farm. Her strategy for the growth of the business is to closely monitor her livestock's health, to increase the number of pigs to raise, to protect them against diseases, and to feed them well. She would like to increase the number of pigs she raises, derive sufficient income from this project, and to reach self-financing. As far as her family and life are concerned, she would like to send all her children to school, pursue her studies, and improve her family's housing.

loans.use: To purchase livestock (pigs) to raise and to build up their farm

loans.name: Marie Helene

texts.fr:
Madame MARIE HÉLÈNE D. est une femme de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis le 06 juillet 2005. Elle a toujours régulièrement remboursé ses crédits. 

Elle est vendeuse de friperie au marché central de la ville. En plus, elle détient à domicile une cantine où elle vend des draps de lit et de vêtements. Par ailleurs, elle fait un petit élevage de poulets.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 02 ballots de friperies, des draps de lit et des vêtements.

son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie Hélène D. is a 49-yeard old woman. She is married and the mother of five children, all of whom are in school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sainte Anne-2 since July 6, 2005. She always repaid her loans on time. She sells second-hand clothing at the central market of her town. In addition, she keeps a small shop at her home, where she sells bed linens and clothing. She also raises chickens.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase two sacks of second-hand clothing, bed linens and [new] clothing. Her goal is to increase her level of savings and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of used clothing

loans.name: Zynash

texts.en:
Zynash A. is 56, widowed and has seven grown children. She is also trustee of her niece who is disabled. Zynash has a higher technical education and worked for a long time as an accountant. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Zynash started her business in cattle breeding. With initial capital of 40,000 KGS, she managed to earn about 6,000 KGS a month. With the revenues, Zynash was able to give a good education to her children. 

Zynash has applied for a loan of 110,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle. It will allow her to raise her sales of milk and meat products. In the future,  Zynash plans to build a huge barn in order to provide a good conditions of cattle maintenance. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking married man with a child living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a desire to educate his child and also build a permanent house. He has been operating as a butcher for the last eight years and the business has been lucrative despite challenges in transport costs and high prices of cows. He desires to have at least four outlets. Paul needs the loan to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Madame Madeleine D. est une femme de 67 ans/ elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 06 petits enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis son inauguration le 04 juin 2002. 

Elle fait de l'élevage et embouche porcine. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 15 ans. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 pourceaux et 02 porcs adultes pour mener son activité d'élevage et d'embouche. 

Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille par l'achat de nourriture, de frais médicaux, de vêtements etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Madeleine D. is a 67-year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven. She also has six grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Sainte Anne 2 since its inauguration on June 4, 2002. She raises and fattens pigs for resale. She is very experienced in this line of work as she has been doing it for over 15 years. Her loan will allow her to purchase 10 piglets and two grown  hogs to develop her livestock business. She contributes to the family budget by covering the costs of food, healthcare, clothing etc.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets and two grown hogs

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a thirty-three-year old single woman with a child living in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda. For seven years she has been selling clothes and with the proceeds she has been able to build a house and pay school fees for her child. She has the challenge of bad debts. Her dream is to set up two boutiques. Pamela needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: C9207 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Thanciene, on the left, is 50 years old and married with eight children between 10 and 28 years old. In this family, only Thanciene works and so she has to work hard to provide everything necessary for her family. She is a businesswoman selling foods such as sugar, rice, breads, and this business is fruitful for her. Thanciene is also the leader of this group which is called "Tuzamurane." The group has five women and one man; most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.

Thanciene and her group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand inventory. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits. Thacienne will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil and sugar to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Madame Julienne F. est une femme de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'01 enfant en charge. Elle a aussi la garde d'un de ses petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 de puis le 14 juin 2002. Elle est également membre du comité de gestion dans lequel elle occupe le poste de présidente en remplacement de l'ancienne qui a rendu sa démission pour raison de maladie

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels, du lait, des biscuits, de l'huile végétale, du pain etc. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Julienne F. is 60 years old, married and the mother of one dependent child. She also takes care of one of her grandchildren. 

She has been a member of the Sainte Anne2 Banc Villageois since June 14 2002. Currently president of the Banc Villageois, she replaced the former president, who resigned. 

Mrs. F. has a store where she sells various products such as milk, cookies, vegetable oil, bread, etc. Her new loan will allow her to increase her supply of merchandise. Her goal is to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois and to help her husband in meeting the family's needs.

loans.use: To stock her store with food products

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is an enterprising single woman with eight children living in her house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For twenty years she has been farming and with the income recieved she has been able to educate her children. She has challenges of labour and her plan is to venture into mechanised agriculture. Teopista needs the loan to grow onions.

loans.use: to grow  onions

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is a farmer, devoted not only to his work but also to being the father of a family. Working hard in the horse-breeding business, he takes his animals out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but love of family provides him with motivation and gives his work meaning. His wife helps him with the business. Naim now wants to improve his situation by expanding his barn and increasing his stock of horses, measures which in the long run will provide a better income.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
Zulaikho is married. She sells fruit at a market in the small city of Kanibadam. She has been in this business for 10 years. She always offers her clients good and fresh food products, providing them with what they need. 

Zulaikho is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She wants to continue her business to make a living for her family. Zulaikho would like to borrow 8000 Somoni to increase her inventory. There are many celebrations in April and May and demand for her products grows. 

Zulaikho has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

loans.use: to expand the range of fruits she sells.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya where he does his mixed farming,producing maize and beans and selling to local middlemen. He is married with four children of school-going age. Emanuel runs a cereals retail shop which generates additional income.

Emanuel has requested a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the loan will improve his productivity hence income so as to enable him to feed, clothe and educate his children. He is also focusing on owning good quality dairy cows.

He laments adverse weather conditions which destroy produce and fluctuating market prices.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tom Ondong

texts.en:
Tom Ondong O. is a gentleman of 36 years. He is married to Rose Achieng and together they have five children. They live in the Mitume area in the outskirts of Kitale. Tom has a shop where he charges car batteries; he has been in this business for eight years and gets a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be Tom's first loan with KADET LTD, and with this loan, he plans to buy battery acid and electronic switches to boost his work. With the income he will get, he wants to use it to repay the loan. 

In the future, Tom wants to educate his children to the highest level, give them a comfortable life and also expand his business.

loans.use: To add stock like electronic switches, battery acid, etc.

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Bekmurod has put much effort into his agricultural activities. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide his five children with everything they need. To develop his business, Bekmurod has made use of loans provided by IMON International, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. 

Once again, Bekmurod seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Bekmurod will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.fr:
Madame ANGÉLIQUE S. est une femme de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est d'une générosité exemplaire qui lui a fait adopter une femme et son enfant (ces personnes ne sont pas des parents, elles sont de simples connaissances) Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis le juin 2002. Elle fait partie des membres du comité de gestion et occupe le poste de trésorière.

Elle fait de l'élevage de poulet de chaire. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter 200 poussins, des produits véto et de l'aliment de volaille pour développer son activité d'élevage. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne tout en soutenant son époux dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Angélique S. is a 48-year old woman. She is married and the mother of four. She is a person of extraordinary generosity, which led her to take a woman with a child into her own family (Angélique is not related to the woman; they just happened to get  acquainted). She has been a member of Banc Villageios of Sainte Anne-2 since June 2002. She belongs to the management committee and serves as the treasurer.

She sells broiler chickens. She has been in this business for over 10 years. Her loan will allow her to purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed and veterinarian supplies in order to grow her business. Her goal is to boost her savings while helping her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of 200 chicks, feed and supplies

loans.name: Helena Jemutai

texts.en:
Helena Jemutai C. is a married woman of 51 years. Her husband, Luka C., is a farmer and adds to the family income. Together they have six children. They live in Iten in the outskirts of Eldoret. 

She sells groceries and cereals in the Iten market and has been in this business for 20 years now. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be Helena's sixth loan from KADET Ltd. She has been repaying all her other loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy more groceries and cereals for resale. 

In the future, Helena wants to buy a plot in Iten town and construct rental houses so that she can get additional income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and cereals for resale

loans.name: Zulfikor

texts.en:
Zulfikor is married and has one daughter. He lives with his family in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Zulfikor sells good quality bedclothes and carpets in the central city market. His vending kiosk is well known in the market for a wide assortment of goods at affordable prices. 

Zulfikor started his venture nine years ago. He is hoping to expand his assortment of goods and is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni. His perfect credit history with IMON International proves his integrity and capacity to repay the current loan. We believe Zulfikor’s ability to transform his business into what he wants it to be and make profit in the process will lead him to ultimate success in the venture.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 10 years, Fatuma has been selling cashew nuts at the market. 

She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the sale of her products. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of cashew nuts in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her livelihood. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is married and lives in Shahrituz, where he operates his own store, selling car spare parts. He has been in this business for 10 years now and because of his determination and customer-friendly attitude, his venture has been very successful. 

Bahrom currently needs a loan of 7000 Somoni to increase his turnover capital. He believes that this loan will help him re-supply his inventory and encourage more customers to come and shop in his store. Increased sales, in turn, will generate the necessary funds to sustain the business as well as help him meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is married with six children. He lives in Gissar, Tajikistan and sells women and men’s shoes at the market. Akram’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 12 years. He is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. 

Akram’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and transport more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.en:
Gulrukhon is a widowed mother of four children. She is also a successful entrepreneur. She sells women's underwear and night gowns in one of the local markets of Dushanbe called "Ganjina." 

Gulrukhon has assorted merchandise and always tries to introduce unique items to her selection of products to keep a stable position in an atmosphere of fierce competition in the market. Gulrukhon has been in this business for 17 years. She is very energetic. She finds time for family, business, personal growth and floral design, which is one of her numerous hobbies. This time she is requesting a loan of 2200 USD to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is divorced. She sells women's shoes at the central market in Dushanbe. Hamisa has been in this business for 18 years already. She likes selling women's shoes and likes working with customers. Hamisa's customers like buying from her as well. Besides that, her good location at the central market provides stable income. 

Hamisa is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to increase the assortment of her goods. She hopes to increase her sales and spend the extra profit to improve her living conditions.
