loans.use: to purchase shoes to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mwanapole

texts.en:
Mwanapole is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past 10 years, selling at the market.  Mwanapole faces a major challenge of scarcity of raw materials due to unfavorable conditions. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a forty-seven year-old, hardworking woman with four children.  She lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She trades in agricultural produce, and the business has been profitable.  Her challenge is price fluctuation. Her desire is to set up a food store.  Gorret needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages polygames, avec en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants, les sept  femmes du groupe Danaya habitent à Kolotomo, dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de matériels agricoles (daba et houe), de calebasses,  de la pâte d’arachide, de la pâte alimentaire, du thé et du sucre. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Yaya C. est connue dans le village et ses environnants pour sa vente de pâtes alimentaires. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un  sac de farine de blé destiné à la transformer en pâte alimentaire. Elle se ravitaille en farine de blé au grand marché de Ségou pour ensuite la transformer en pâte alimentaire (vermicelles macaroni etc.) 
Elle malaxe la farine de blé avec de l’eau seulement puis on la fait passer petit à petit à travers la machine en la manillant. A l’autre bout de la machine on recueille la pâte en fonction de la forme voulue par le réglage de l’appareil. On l’étale ensuite au soleil pour séchage pendant 6 heures de temps au moins dans un séchoir suivi de son emballage dans les sachets plastiques prêt à la vente. 
Elle vend au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant au marché de Pelengana et dans les villages voisins à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Yaya C. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans cette activité à travers ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Danaya solidarity group are all married and living in polygamous households. They average 41 years of age and four children each. They live in Kolotomo, in the rural commune of Pelengana, which is located in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. 

They sell farming equipment (African and eye hoes), calabashes, groundnut paste, pasta, tea and sugar. In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They are on their first loan cycle. 

Mrs. Yaya C. is known in the village and surrounding areas for selling pasta. She plans to use her loan to buy a sack of wheat flour to make pasta. She gets her wheat flour at the grand market of Ségou, and then turns it into pasta (vermicelli, macaroni, etc.). 

She kneads the wheat flour with water, and then the dough is handled to slowly go through a small device. It comes out the machine in a pre-set shape. Then, the dough is laid out to dry in the sun for at least six hours. This is followed by packaging in plastic bags, ready to be sold. 

She sells for cash or credit, from her home, and also at the Pelengana market and nearby villages, to a clientele composed of both men and women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Yaya C. hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA to be used for reinvestment in the business and small household expenses. She hopes that her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso will help her to become a wholesaler in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk for resale

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Kolotomo, dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de matériels agricoles (daba et houe), de galettes à base de mil et du lait. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame Ramata D.  qui est connue dans le village pour sa vente de céréales, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 sacs de mil avec les forains des villages environnants de Ségou petit à petit. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Ramata D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité à travers ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The six women of the group Tièssiri are married and living mostly in monogamous households. They average 43 years of age and four children each, and they live in the village of Kolotomo, in the rural commune of Pelengana, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage, community, and kinship. The group members have small-scale businesses involving farming equipment (daba and hoes) and pancakes made from millet and milk.   Needing to increase their working capital and to be resupplied with cash, the group members joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. The five previous loans have all been repaid without any difficulties at all. Ms. Ramata D., who is known in the village for selling grains, plans on using her loan to buy 7 sacks of millet little by little from market vendors of villages around Ségou. Retail sales are made by cash or credit at the house. Her customer base comprise women and men. With this loan, Ms. Ramata D. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting the needs of the young ones at home. Her goal is to increase her business volume through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Don Hilarion es comerciante, está casado y tiene dos hijos, él se dedica al comercio y está en el ramo desde hace más de 5 años realizando la venta de revistas, periódicos, tiras cómicas, etc.
El mismo realiza esta actividad con su señora, en un puesto que está situado sobre la Avenida Irala de la ciudad de Pilar.
Posee una casa propia, en la misma ciudad, con comodidades básicas para el desarrollo de su actividad.
Desde ya agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya, por otorgarle la esperanza de adquirir asistencia técnica y financiera para el buen desarrollo de su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Hilarion is a salesman.  He is married and has two children.  He is in the sales business and has been in this line of work for more than 5 years.

Hilarion sells magazines, newspapers and comics, etc.  He works in the business together with his wife and they sell their products from a stall which is located on Avenida Irala, in the city of Pilar.

Hilarion owns his own home in the city of Pilar and has the basic amenities he needs in order to carry out his business.  He would like to thank Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for giving him the hope of acquiring technical and financial help that will enable him to make good progress in his business.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines, comics, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Kitale, in Western Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for eight years and supports his children, who are 3, 11 and 14 years of age, through the farming business. Currently, he sells maize, bananas and sugarcane locally. 

Joseph has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to buy a dairy cow. The income from the cow will help pay for his children's education and feed his family. In five years time he wants to purchase three motorbikes for transporting the dairy produce.

Like many farmers in Kenya, Joseph believes that unpredictable weather conditions and low prices are the biggest challenges facing the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a thirty year-old, single mother living with her parents in Fort Portal Uganda.  She takes care of her parents and child, and her dream is to buy land and construct a house.  She decorates at parties and also has a poultry farm, which has helped her in providing for the family.  Joselyne needs the money to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed .

loans.name: Tendo Winners Group-Kayunga

texts.en: 35 year-old Esther N. is affiliated with Tendo Winners Group-Kayunga.  She has been in a pub business for the past 10 years. Esther, who is happily married with 3 kids, also has a pig husbandry project in her village. Income from the pub has enabled her to shoulder most of her family-related responsibilities, including the payment of school fees for her kids. She anticipates improved circumstances after she gets this loan. She says she is going to purchase more crates of beer and other highly-favored beverages to resell at the pub.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer and other beverages to resell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesus O. T. tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una casa de su propiedad, vivienda que esta ubicada en el Barrio San Salvador de esta ciudad de Tarija. Jesus es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes cuida y apoya en sus estudios junto con su esposa la señora Delia Condori Rueda. Ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y  esposa. Jesus se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años al servicio de transporte de agregados (arena, ripio, grava, gravilla, etc. Materiales para la construcción) Los cuales entrega en las diferentes construcciones de la ciudad. Teniendo buena clientela que prefieren ocupar sus servicios por ser una persona puntual y responsable. Jesus quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto su esposa e hijos , pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar ruedas nuevas para su herramienta de trabajo, es por eso que el credito sera destinado para la compra de ruedas. Que son de gran necesidad para su volqueta( que es su herramienta de trabajo) y de esa forma poder realizar sin problemas el servicio de transporte de agregados. De ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos que mucha falta le hacen.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Jesus nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo crédito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Jesus O. T. is 36 years old and lives in his own home which is located in San Salvador neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  Jesus has two children who he cares for and supports in their education together with his wife, Delia Condori Rueda.  He has to work in order to get his children and wife ahead in life.

For more than 7 years Jesus has been providing a transport service, transporting aggregate construction materials (sand and different grades of gravel).  He delivers his products to different construction sites in the city.  Jesus has good customers who prefer to use his services because he is a punctual and responsible person.  He would like to make better profits in order to get ahead in life together with his wife and children but he tells us that he needs to buy new wheels for his truck (his work tool) so that he can carry out his transportation service without problems.  In this way, he will be able to increase his income which he needs very much.

Jesus tells us that he would like to improve his living conditions and so he will use his next loan to improve the condition of his home.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his truck (his work tool)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old and a single mother of one child.  She does tailoring so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for ten years.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to buy a sewing machine.  This has allowed her to improve her business. 

 In future, she hopes to expand her business so as to get more customers.  She has requested 35,000 Kes to buy fabric, needles and buttons.

loans.use: To buy fabric, needles and buttons.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos es mecánico y  también vende accesorios  para movilidad; el crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas como ser limpia parabrisas, repuestos para motores  ya que tiene mas demanda en estos artículos para movilidad. Con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en Anticrético en una casa ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Carlos is a mechanic and also sells vehicle accessories.  He needs this loan to buy items such as windshield wipers and spare parts for engines since he has a lot of demand for them.  Carlos uses the income he makes to support himself.  He lives in a rental house, in Las Lomas neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy windshield wipers and spare parts for engines, for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is 31 years old, married and a mother of three.  For three years, she has been operating a grocery store.  In addition, she does poultry farming so as to supplement her family’s income.  She was previously employed in a hotel and decided to go into business so that she would get enough income to meet her family’s needs.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for 35,000 Kes to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To enlarge her little fruit and vegetables business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty-six-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of buying a motorcycle for transport business. For thirteen years he has been growing tomatoes and riding a motorcycle. He has a hardship of prolonged drought and his desire is to own at least ten acres of tomato garden and export them. Robert needs the loan to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 35 years old, married, with four children.  She does dairy farming for a living.  She has been farming for the past four years.  She also does crop farming together with her husband.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to educate her children because her business has improved.  She hopes to become a prosperous farmer in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 33 years old and is married with four children aged between 1 and 12 years old. Esperance sells fruit & vegetables. Her business is well organized and the hours of her business are from 8am until 5pm every day. This is her first year of experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more fruit and vegetables to sell. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her to earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy more fruits & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cecibel

texts.es:
Doña Cecibel, reside en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán, tiene 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, antojitos, bisutería y ropa. Ella vive con su esposo don Maudo Antonio y un hijo Juan Antonio de 18 años de edad.
El negocio es una variedad de productos: comida (desayunos y almuerzos), por las tardes antojitos (enchiladas, pasteles), Ropa, Bisutería y artículos de uso personal como prendedores de cabello, cosméticos, esta diversidad de artículos lo tiene en su propia casa, por lo que  no tiene un horario fijo para atender a los clientes. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa, ya que desea aumentar el inventario teniendo diversidad de ropa.
Este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir esta parte del negocio y mantenerse en buenos niveles de inventario y ofrecer a los clientes  prendas de vestir a la moda y para todos los gustos; el sueño de doña Cecibel es hacer una casa en un terreno frente donde vive hoy, este sueño hace que ella permanezca con ánimos para continuar en el negocio y realizarlo dentro de poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Doña Cecibel resides in El Divisadero in the Department of Morazán. She is 46 years old and sells food, snacks, trinkets, and clothing. Cecibel lives with her husband Don Maudo Antonio and her 18 year old son Juan.

Her business includes a variety of products: food (breakfast and lunch), afternoon snacks (enchiladas and pastries), clothing, trinkets, and personal use items such as hairpins and cosmetics. She offers these different products from her home. Cecibel attends to her customers, but she does not work on a fixed schedule. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy clothes so that she can increase her inventory and offer more variety.

This loan will help cover part of her business and maintain her inventory at good levels. As a result, she will be able to offer her customers fashions for all tastes. Her dream is to build a store on the land in front of where she lives today. She is determined to continue with her business so she wants to pursue this goal very soon.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 28 years old and is married. For one year he has owned a small store which sells grocery items such as: lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar etc. His business is open from 7am until 5pm every day and he currently employs three people to help him.

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase goods in larger quantities in order to get a better price. He hopes to earn more profits. With these profits he expects to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase goods in larger quantities in order to get a better price.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio San Rafael, allí tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar su actividades dentro del seno familiar, además de movilidad propia (moto).
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en especial ropas ocasionales para damas, desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, y ahora posee la infraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de su pequeño comercio, lo bueno es que sus prendas son muy reconocidas y de gran aceptación en la comunidad.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de más ropas (shorts, polleras, remeras, blusas, pantalones, etc.); y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través del crédito concedido.
texts.en:
26 year-old Mariela is single and lives in the city of Pilar, in San Rafael neighborhood.  She owns her own home and has the basic amenities she needs to carry out her activities within the heart of her family.  She also owns her own vehicle (a motorbike).

Mariela's business is selling clothes, especially ladies' casual clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years and she now owns the infrastructure she needs to carry out her small business.  The clothes she sells are very well regarded and popular in her community.

Mariela is requesting this loan to invest in buying more clothes (shorts, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc.) and she is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have given her through this loan.

loans.use: to buy casual clothes (shorts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc.)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 48-year-old single mother of one.  She has been able to bring up her 22-year-old child with the income she gets by selling health products. She left employment seven years ago and went into business so that she would earn better income.  She hopes to have a fully established business in the future.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for the business training that they offer. She has requested 20,000 Kes from Faulu Kenya to buy depressor and a blood pressure machine.

loans.use: To buy a depressor and blood pressure machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy newspapers

loans.name: Mican

texts.en:
Mican is a member of Chitosan group under Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group after he was introduced by a friend.  Since then, his business where he sells health-related products has improved.  He has been running his business for two years.  He was previously selling drinks and doing farming.  

Being a married man with two children, he works hard at his business so as to provide for his family.  He hopes to open more outlets for his business.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more health-related products.

loans.use: To buy more health-related products.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with two children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with an aspiration of building a permanent house in the next five years. For twelve years she has been operating a retail shop with which she started with 200,000/= and now her business is worth 3,000,000. She has challenges in price fluctuations and her desire is to own a wholesale shop. Veneranda needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Delmi Aracely

texts.es:
Delmi es una joven de 19 años de edad que reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y una hija de un año de edad, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, tiene 2 años  de experiencia, trabaja a tiempo completo, el negocio esta instalado en el mercado municipal.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de accesorios y celulares,  esta compra es para ofrecer a los clientes las diferentes marcas y estilos de celulares, también accesorios para dichos teléfonos.

La aspiración de ella es algún día tener casa propia,  un negocio fuerte y local propio, ayudando a mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Delmi is a young woman of 19-years-old. She lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter. She sells cell phones and phone accessories, and has 2 years of experience in this field. She works full time and her business is located in the municipal market. 

She's requesting this loan to buy cell phones and accessories in order to offer her customers various brands and styles. 

Her aspiration is to some day own her own home, have a strong business and shop of her own, and help improve her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy accessories and cell phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and clothing

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo López A. tiene 45 años de edad concubinos con la Señora. Segundina Miranda Montecinos mas de 10 años tienen 4 hijos menores viven en casa prestada solo pagan de luz y agua en sindicato Rosario a 52 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

El señor Gerardo es agricultor produce papa, papaliza, haba y cría ganado vacuno necesitan capital para comprar abono orgánico ya que en esta época el abono esta barato y ellos no tienen todavía ingresos económicos de la producción agrícola, el señor Gerardo es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. Se tomo la iniciativa de acudir  a la zona a otorgar crédito, el Sr Gerardo está muy contento de saber que puede conseguir  un crédito, para poder comprar el abono orgánico oportunamente y alistar para la siembra de este año,  así tendrá ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos y para construir su casa ese es su mayor sueño tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo López A. is 45 years old and has lived with Ms. Segundina Miranda Montecinos for over 10 years. They have 4 young children who are living in a house that has been loaned to them in which they only pay for electricity and water. They live in the trade union of Rosario 52 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

Gerardo is a farmer who grows potatoes, papalizas (South American potato), beans, and raises cattle. They need capital to buy organic fertilizer since  fertilizer is cheap at this time yet they still do not have income from their agricultural production. Gerardo is a humble, responsible and hard working man. For him it is very difficult to go to the banks in the city because they have many requirements. He takes the initiative to go to the area where they extend credit. Gerardo is very happy to know that he can get a loan to buy organic fertilizer at the appropriate time for planting this year. He will be saving for their childrens' studies and to build a house. It is his greatest dream to have his own home.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Emma Miriam

texts.es:
Emma de 21 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y una hija de 21 años de edad, ellos viven en casa alquilada, administran el negocio desde hace 3 años, trabaja a tiempo completo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de celulares y accesorios, cargadores, estuches entre otros, este préstamo la ayudara a compara lo necesario para el negocio y atender mejor a los clientes.

Su aspiración es tener casa propia y ver crecer el negocio, que a través de él pueda tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Emma is 21 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán.  She sells mobile phones and accessories for a living. Her family is comprised of her husband and 21 year-old daughter.  They all live in a rental property.  She has been running her business for three years and works full time.

She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers and cases, among other things).  The loan will help her buy what she needs for the business to improve customer service.

Her goal is to have her own home and expand business so she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers, cases, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Prudencia

texts.es:
Doña María, de 66 años de edad , es madre de 5 hijos ,no es casada, es originaria del departamento de Masaya, pero vive en la ciudad de Estelí desde 1970 , se dedica a vender frutas y plantas tiene de dedicarse a este negocio 36 años. Comenzó a los 29 años de edad con el negocio de ventas de frutas con prestamos y fiando las frutas  a s distribuidores mayoristas. Su primer negocio fue venta de mercadería ambulante, también bordaba a mano, cocía en maquina pues sabe costura. No logro estudiar toda la primaria ya que sus padres eran pobres y ese era un lujo que no se podía dar, así que se dedico a trabajar. Actualmente vende frutas y plantas  tales como platas frutales, hornamentales, florales etc. En este negocio la ayudan dos de sus hijos el resto de ellos trabajan por su propia cuenta son independientes, ella venden sus frutas y plantas en la calle central frente a su casa, además ella es dueña dos módulos los cuales renta para obtener otra fuente de ingreso.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras y un  toldo para proteger las frutas del sol  ya que esta le da de frente  directo a sus frutas. El crédito le ayudara para obtener ganancias que le permitan realizar mejoras al local donde tiene el negocio. Tiene planes hacerles mejoras de infraestructura a puesto de frutas y a su casa. Pues el hogar donde crio a sus hijos lo compro trabajando fuerte ella sola siendo madre soltera.
texts.en:
Doña María is 66 years old and is the mother of 5 children.  She is not married.  She is from the department of Masaya, but she has lived in the city of  Estelí since 1970.  She works selling fruits and plants, and has had this business for 36 years.  She began the fruit selling business when she was 29 years old with loans and on credit, selling to the best distributors.  Her first business was selling on foot in an open air market, also handicrafts, and sewing with a machine as she knows how to do tailoring work.  She didn't manage to finish primary school as her parents were poor, and this was a luxury and she couldn't have.  Therefore, she dedicated herself to work.  Currently, she sells fruit and trees like fruit plants, ornamentals, flowers, etc.  Two of her children help her with this work.  The others work for themselves and are independent.  She sells fruit and plants in the central street in front of her house, also she is the owner of two units which she rents to have another source of income.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy fruit, vegetables, and an awning to protect the fruits from the sun that currently shines directly on her fruits.  The loan will help her to obtain better earnings, that would allow her to make improvements to the location where she has the business.  She has plans to make infrastructure improvements to her fruit stall and to her house.  She bought the house where she raised her children by working hard herself, as she is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and an awning

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú Group

texts.es:
El grupo "San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú" ya está en el 2 ciclo del programa, ellas utilizan el crédito para la compra de materiales para sus diversos negocios, este grupo se formó el 27 de agosto  del 2010, y hasta la fecha siguen siendo parte del programa de Comité Mujeres Rurales, ya que en él encuentran la ayuda económica que necesitan para continuar sus actividades y así mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
La sra. Dora T. se destaca en el grupo ya que ella se dedica al lavado de ropa y ella dice que gracias a la fundación pudo iniciar su mini-comercio y hoy día solicita el crédito nuevamente para comprar un lavarropas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
The group “ San Juan Bautista Ñeembucú” is currently in it second cycle of this program.  They use the loan to buy materials for their various businesses.  This group was formed the 27th of August, 2010, and since that date they have continued to be part of the program of the Committee of Rural Women, from which they find the economic help they need in order to continue their activities and so improve their quality of life and that of their family.

Dora T. stands out from the group as she works washing clothing, and she wash that thanks to the foundation she was able to begin her micro-business and today she is asking for a new loan in order to buy a washing machine and so increase her output.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a una hija de 30 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 14 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 5:00am a 6:00pm, este negocio viene de familia y hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades para realizarlo.
Ella está actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en compra de materiales para preparar más alimentos, esta ayuda fortalecerá el negocio manteniendo de aquellos productos como pollo, carnes, condimentos, aceite y bebidas, ya que por ellos se realiza cada día los diferentes menús.
Doña Rosa, aspira continuar en el negocio, que le provea los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos cotidianos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 65 years old, she lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department, with one daughter aged 30. She has been engaging in selling meals for 14 years, and she works every day of the week form 5 am to 6 pm. This is a family activity, and up to now she has not encountered any difficulties in her job.
She is currently requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare more meals. Her activity will be strengthened because she will restock her shop with products such as chicken, meat, dressings, oil and drinks, that she uses daily to prepare her various menus.
Doña Rosa wishes to keep on running her activity, as this provides her with the necessary income to pay for her daily expenses.
.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: C2367 Twubahane Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 27 years old and married with two children and takes care of one dependent. He owns a business selling a foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, and salt. He is the leader of the group which is called "Twubahane" in the local language.  This group contains four members; one woman and three men. Ferdinand is the first person on the right side. 

Ferdinand and his group has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing more products such as: sugar, bread, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Ferdinand will be able to earn more profit which will be used for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, bread, salt, rice, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Emilia

texts.es:
Isabel, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, madre soltera, es comerciante se dedica a vender  elotes,  tortillas ,tamales , güirilas y montucas, debido a su condiciones de pobreza sus padres no pudieron seguir pagándoles sus estudios solo logro cursar el sexto grado de primaria. De ahí en adelante se dedico a trabajar. A los 35 años de edad comenzó con su propio negocio de venta de tamales y productos derivados del maíz, esto lo hizo por medio de un préstamo  que le otorgaron y lo invirtió en compra de 300 tamales que ella misma vendía en las calles de Estelí, antes de vender tamales también vendía cosméticos y ropa a los trabajadores de fabricas tabacaleras. Actualmente compra 1,500 elotes cada tres días y tiene 5 vendedores, tres bicicletas que se utilizan para vender el producto en las calles. Le gustaría que sus productos se dieran a conocer en las ferias, supermercados para aumentar sus ventas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar 4000 elotes, pues esto le ayudara a comprar materia y aumentar sus ventas. Sus planes futuros son la preparación universitaria de sus hijos, pues desea que ellos tengan un futuro mejor que ella y puedan salir adelante en la vida. Tiene como meta próxima remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel is originally from the department of Estelí.  She is 46-years-old, a mother of three children, a single mother, and a businesswoman who works selling corn on the cob, tortillas, tamales, güirilas (sweet corn pancake), and montucas (similar to tamales but slightly sweeter).  Because of their poverty, her parents could not continue paying her studies and she only managed to complete the sixth year of primary school.  From then on she worked.  When she was 35-years-old, she began her own business selling tamales and corn-based products.  She did this with a loan that was offered to her and invested it in buying 300 tamales that she then sold in the streets of Estelí.  Before she sold tamales she also sold cosmetics and clothing to the tobacco factory workers.  Now she buys 1,500 ears of corn every three days and has five sellers and three bicycles that they use to sell the products in the streets.  She would like for her products to be sold in the fairs and supermarkets in order to increase her sales.  
She is requesting the loan to buy 4000 ears of corn as this will help her to buy ingredients and increase her sales.  Her future plans are to prepare her children for the university as she would like them to have a better future than her so that they can get ahead in life.  A goal of hers is to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy 4000 ears of corn.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio B. S. tiene 33 años de edad y vive desde hace varios años en la comunidad de Chocloca casa  que es de  propiedad de su suegra. Sergio es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes cuida y apoya en sus estudios junto con su esposa Gilda Janeth Añizares quien participa de la presente solicitud de crédito ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su esposa e  hijos. Sergio se dedica desde hace mas de 8 años a trabajar en una empresa como perforista de rocas para la construcción de canales de riego, la empresa en la que trabaja se denomina "Soinbol S.R.L."  Sergio quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su esposa e hijos, pero él nos cuenta que quiere comprarse una máquina perforadora para poder trabajar de una manera más efectiva como él ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicha máquina que es necesaria para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Sergio nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sergio B. S. is 33-years-old and has lived in the Chocloca community for many years in a house that his mother-in-law owns.  Sergio is the father of two children who he takes care of and supports in their studies along with his wife Gilda Janeth Añizares who is participating in the current loan request.  Now he has to work to be able to get ahead along with his wife and children.  Sergio has worked for more than eight years in a business as a rock driller for the construction of irrigation canals.  The business where he works is called Soinbol S.R.L.  Sergio would like to have a better income so that he can get ahead along with his wife and children, but he tells us that he wants to buy a drilling machine in order to work more effectively as now he has experience in the area.  The loan will be used to buy this machine that is necessary to do this work so that in this way he can increase his income.
Sergio tells us that he wants to improve his quality of life, he says that the next loan he requests will be to improve the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy work tools for well drilling.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El Señor Abrahan O. R., es una persona de 20 años de edad de estado civil soltero, pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en casa de sus padres y tiene un pequeño hijo. La actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce anualmente papa, oca y haba el cual los comercializa en la feria semanal de la población de Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 67 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

En la actividad agrícola trabaja junto a su esposa, la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en parcelas heredadas de sus padres, pero en la actualidad producto de sus ganancias pudieron adquirir 2 parcelas cultivables y para tal efecto necesitan capital de inversión para comprar mayor cantidad de semilla de papa y de tal forma poder incrementar su producción de este producto y obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Abrahan O. R. is a 20-year old man who is not married but he lives with someone. He finished primary school and he lives with his parents. He has a young son. His principal activity is agriculture, producing potato, okra, and fava beans every year. He sells his products at the weekly fair in the community of Tiraque, which is approximately 67 km from the city of Cochabamba.

His wife helps him with his agriculture business. He cultivates his plantations on parcels of land inherited to him by his parents but as a product of their earnings they have managed to acquire 2 more lots. For this reason they need to invest capital funds in order to increase production of their products and to obtain a greater income and so to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Marlene Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Marlene, tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria de Telpaneca  municipio  de l departamento de Nueva Segovia, pero actualmente vive en centro del departamento de  Estelí, es casada, tiene2 hijas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida y alquiler de cuarto. Inicio este negocio en el año 1998 para cuando sucedió el huracán Mitch en ese entonces ella tenia 45 años, sus primeros clientes fuero unos extranjeros que pertenecen a una iglesia mormona . A la edad de 17 años  comenzó a trabajar en el negocio de sastrería, sus padres la ayudaron para que estudiara un curso de sastrería esta actividad la ejerció  hasta 1998 que fue cuando inicio con su  negocio propio.  
Para  administrar su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, también recibe apoyo de un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos.
El alquiler de cuarto lo comenzó motivada por unos extranjeros que tocaron su puerta preguntando por alquiler de cuartos. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar una ventana de aluminio, vidrio,  cerámica, pintura, remodelar cuartos de su negocio. Con el préstamo podrá mejorar el servicio a sus clientes para que tengan  un buen confort  y mejorar la presentación de su vivienda, ya que al mejorar la infraestructura delas habitaciones  podrá atraer mas clientes y expandir su negocio.  
Tiene como plan futuro construir más habitaciones, ponerle garaje a su negocio. Como metas principales  terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios a su hija menor quien actualmente esta cursando tercer año de administración de empresas y poner un  negocio de fritanga  a fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Marlene is 57 years old and she is originally from the municipality of Telpaneca of the department of Nueva Segovia. But she currently lives in the central region of the department of Esteli. She is married and she has 2 daughters. She is a merchant and she sells prepared foods and she rents out a bedroom. She started this business in 1998, when hurricane Mitch happened, at which time she was 45 years old. Her first clients were foreigners that belonged to a Mormon church. She started to work at the age of 17, working at a tailoring shop. Her parents helped her to attend a course in tailoring.  This was her business until 1998 when she started her own business.

Her eldest daughter helps her to manage the business and she also receives some support from one of her brothers who lives in the United States.

She started renting out a bedroom because she was motivated by some foreigners that knocked at her door inquiring about lodging.

The loan that she requests will be used to purchase a window, glass, ceramic tiling, and paint to remodel the rooms she uses for her business.  With the help of this loan she will be able to improve the service she provides to her clients in order to improve their comfort and to improve the presentation. Improving the infrastructure of the bedrooms will attract more clients and she will be able to expand her business.

Her plan for the future is to build more bedrooms and to put a garage in for her business. Her primary goal is to finish paying her youngest daughter's university tuition fees. She is currently in third year of business administration. She also plans on setting up a fast food business in her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to remodel bedrooms used fpr lodging

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos adolescentes que le ayudan a salir adelante, pues desean juntos alcanzar el progreso. Desde muy joven, esta emprendedora mujer observaba como su padre confeccionista realizaba cortinas y  desde entonces empezó su afán por aprender a confeccionar. Cuando debió sacar adelante a sus hijos no dudo en continuar con todo lo aprendido y empezó con la producción de prendas de vestir. En la actualidad esta muy satisfecha pues tiene varios pedidos de prendas, pues por temporadas le encargan y ella trata de cumplir con todos con la ayuda de su hija de 15 años, quien domina muy bien la máquina de coser. Dice que los colegios de la zona también le encargan pedidos de buzos y uniformes escolares por lo que tiene pedidos con frecuencia y esta vez tiene un gran pedido pero no tiene capital para concretarlo, es por esta razón que solicita el crédito. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar dos máquinas más de coser para que su hijo mayor le ayude y así continuar progresando en este rubro. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible que pueda continuar con su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de diversas telas que necesita para continuar con la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and she lives in her own home together with her two adolescent children. They contribute and together they want to progress. Since she was very young, this enterprising woman she learned from her father when he made curtains. Since then it has been her focus to learn to sew. When she needed to provide for her children she had no doubt about using the skills that she learned and she started making articles of clothing. She is very happy because she has various orders that are placed for the season and she tries to fill them all with the help of her 15-year old daughter who excels in using the sewing machine.  She says that the schools in the region also place orders for jackets and school uniforms which is why she often has orders. But this time she has received a large order and she doesn't have the capital funds to fill it, which is why she requests a loan. For the future she plans on purchasing two sewing machines so that her eldest daughter will help her and therefore continue progressing in the business. Maria plans on investing the loan she requests on purchasing a variety of fabrics that she needs to keep making articles of clothing, and in this manner continue to advance.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing

loans.name: Meiby Orquidea

texts.es:
Meiby, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel,tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, es empleada en una unidad de salud encargada de archivo, al mismo tiempo y con ayuda de su esposo tienen un taller de vehículos, desde hace 10 años, por el momento su dificultad es la falta de repuestos y herramientas por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos materiales tan importantes para el buen funcionamiento del taller.
Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con las herramientas necesarias para atender los desperfectos mecánicos de los vehículos que los clientes lleven, así ofrecerá un mejor servicio.
Su aspiración es crecer con el local del taller, ampliándolo para estar más cómodos y atender a un número mayor de vehículos, también garantizar una mejor condición a su familia.
texts.en:
Meiby lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters aged 5 and 3. She is an archivist working in a health unit; on top of this, she and her husband have been running a repair shop for 10 years. Their main current difficulty is the lack of spare parts and tools; for this reason she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy the key items she needs for the garage to be fully operational.
This investment will help her buying the necessary tools to repair the mechanical flaws of her customers’ vehicles, thus enabling her to provide a better service.
She wishes to see her garage grow, and to enlarge it both to have a more comfortable working space and to hold a higher number of vehicles; she also wants to guarantee better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Ana Delmis Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 30 años D. edad, su familia la conforman: su esposo y un hijo D. dos años; ella se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, negocio que inicio por la colaboración D. sus suegros quienes le enseñaron el negocio, no tiene un horario fijo y posee hoy día mucha experiencia en el cuido D. los cerdos, su alimentación, salud y el precio para comercializarlos. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en cerdos, ya que desea adquirir varios cerdos para aumentar su granja.
Con respecto al negocio Ana aspira tener en su granja los mejores cerdos, comercializarlos a buen precio y en su familia aspira ir mejorando las ganancias para ahorrar y estabilizar la condición D. su esposo e hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  Her family is comprised of her husband and a two year-old son.  For a living she raises pigs, which is the activity she began with the collaboration of her parents-in-law who taught her about the business.  She does not have any fixed work hours.  She has acquired a lot of expertise in raising pigs, such as how to feed them, related health aspects and sales pricing.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs in order to increase her livestock farm.

Ana's goal is to have a farm with the best pigs so she can sell them at a good price and improve income so she can save money and proviD. a more stable environment for her husband and son.

loans.use: To buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Señor Felix A. M., es una persona de 34 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, tiene 3  hijos dependientes de sus ingresos económicos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce papa, maíz, haba, arveja y trigo en la comunidad de Inka LLajta del municipio de Pocona distante aproximadamente a unos 130 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
                                                                                                                                              
En la actividad agrícola intervienen toda la familia la esposa y los hijos, los trabajos de arado del terreno lo realizan con tracción animal razón por la cual se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de ganado bovino (yunta) ya que los anteriores que tenían fueron vendidos para la compra de terreno agrícola de tal forma poder incrementar su producción de los distintos productos que cultivan y a su vez poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Felix Alvardo M. is 34-years-old and married.  He managed to study primary school, he lives in his own home, and he has three children who depend on his income.  His main work is in agriculture producing potatoes, corn, fava beans, peas, and wheat in the Inca Llajta community in the Pocona municipality which is about 130 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

The whole family, his wife and children, work in agriculture.  They do the plowing with animals pulling the plow and that is why they see the necessity of requesting capital to invest in the purchase of a team of steers as the previous ones were sold to buy the agricultural field.  In this way they will be able to increase their production of the different products they grow and at the same time obtain a better income.  In this way they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle livestock for agricultural work.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
la señora Virginia S. Agüero tiene 53 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Jicaro Galan de Nacaome, Virginia se dedica a la produccion y venta de quesillo, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de sus hijos para la elaboracion del quesillo, ademas tiene 4 empleados mas.
su meta es tener mayor produccion y asi emplear mas personas, generar empleo.
gracias a su negocio a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que educarlos y mantenerlos sin ninguna ayuda.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leche y leña, en estos momentos la demanda de sus clientes ha aumentado y necesita cubrir con todos los pedidos.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia S. Agüero is 53 years old. She lives in the community of Jicaro Galan de Nacaome. Virginia is engaged in the production and sale of cheese. She runs her business in her house. Her children help her in making cheese. She also has 4 more employees.

Her goal is to have greater production and, thus, employ more people. Thanks to her business, she has succeeded in helping her children to get ahead since she had to educate them and provide for them without any help.

The loan will be used for the purchase of cow’s milk and firewood. Currently, the demand from her customers has grown and she needs to meet all her orders. She told us that she is very happy since everything is going very well.

loans.use: To purchase cow's milk and firewood

loans.name: 12 Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “12 ESTRELLAS” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora  Eliza, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, entre ellos tenemos: costura, venta de papa, macramé, venta de camas, venta de chicharrón, venta de verduras, confección de ropa, producción de mandiles.

La señora Eliza, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “12 Estrellas”  tres ciclos, pero ha trabajado con Pro Mujer cerca de once años.   La señora Eliza tiene como negocio la confección de ropa y su crédito será destinado a la compra de mercadería  (se entiende telas), esta mercadería será comprada de la feria de la zona 16 de Julio, la venta  es realizada en todas las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.  La señora Eliza está casada y tiene dos hijos; como su negocio requiere de llevar la ropa a las diferentes ferias día tras día, recibe la ayuda del esposo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
En la fotografia se observa a doce personas, debido a que las señora  Susi, hija de la señora Juana, estaba presente. Al fondo una socia se reía y no se la ve bien, ella es la señora Lucia.
texts.en:
The nonprofit “12 Estrellas” (12 Stars) will begin their third cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of Germán Busch’s focal group.  It is made up of 11 members and the communal association is directed by a board that is headed by Eliza, the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association work in are varied.  Among them we have: sewing, selling potatoes, macramé, selling beds, selling chicharrón (fried pork cracklings), selling vegetables, making clothing, and making aprons.

Eliza, the president of the communal association, says that she has been a part of the nonprofit “12 Estrellas” for three cycles but has worked with Pro Mujer for close to 11 years.  Eliza has a clothing making business and her loan will be put towards buying the goods she uses (fabrics).  This merchandise will be bought in the local fair on July 16th.  She will sell her clothing in all of the fairs for the city of El Alto.  Eliza is married and has two children.  As her business requires her to take clothing to the different fairs day after day, her husband helps her.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the advice.

In the photograph you can see 12 people as Susi, the daughter of Juana, was present.  At the back a member is laughing and you cannot see her very well; she is Lucia.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fabrics).

loans.name: Anna Noemi

texts.es:
Anna, de 35 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su esposo y un hijo de 6 años de edad, ella administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, ella inicio este negocio hace un año y medio, con ayuda de su esposo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, esta inversión es con la intención de mejorar la atención a los clientes, ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de productos de uso familiar.
Ella tiene como objetivo mantener el negocio fuerte, que le genere ganancias para ayudar así a su hijo a iniciar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Anna is 35 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with her husband and 6 year-old son.  She has a general store that she set up a year and a half ago with the help of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy staple goods in order to improve customer service and offer a wider variety of products.

Her goal is to keep her business strong and generate enough earnings to help her son who is beginning his education.

loans.use: To buy staple goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 64 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Víctor de 60 años,  su hija mayor, su yerno y su nieto; juntos buscan progresar cada día. Desde hace 10 años, esta emprendedora mujer empezó con la venta de bijouteria de una marca reconocida de accesorios para mujer. Dice que las ventas son buenas, pues su hija es gerente de la empresa que la provee y compra las joyas a precios mínimos, es por esta razón que ella trabaja apoyada por su hija. Esta muy contenta pues mientras comercializa las joyas a conocidas y amigas puede cuidar de su pequeño nieto ya que su hija se lo encarga mientras ella trabaja. Aunque es sacrificado cuidar a su pequeño nieto, por tanto tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar sus ventas para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de bijouteria, pues quiere comprar nuevos modelos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en: Rosa is 64 years old.  She lives in her own home along with her husband Victor, who is 60 years old, her eldest daughter, her son-in-law and her grandson.  They work together to get ahead each day.  10 years ago, this enterprising woman began selling costume jewelry of a well known brand for women's accessories.  She says that the sales are good, and her daughter is the manager of the business that supplies her, and so she buys the jewelry at the lowest prices.  This is why she does this, helped by her daughter.  She is very happy that while she sells the jewels to acquaintances and friends she is able to care for her small grandson, as her daughter entrusts him to Rosa while she works.  Although she is sacrificing to care for her small grandson, for a long time she has had many plans for the future, like growing her sales in order to improve her earnings  This is the 7th loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the support that will permit her to continue working in search of progress.  Rosa has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of costume jewelry, and she wants to buy new models in order to offer the best to her clients, and in this manner she hopes to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry to offer to her clients
